commentHeader: said the wheel chair would be ordered
reviewContent: I was traveling to Orlando Florida from EWR flight #1213 departing Newark at 2:53pm Sept 16. I was taken to gate C132 via wheel chair, the wheel chair person dropped me off at gate c132 and said the wheel chair would be ordered from the gate to take me to the plane. We asked the gate attendant about the wheel chair she told us she had ordered it. It never came so we again asked to no avail. I finally had to navigate as best as I could, we were boarded last. I asked the flight attendant on the plane about the wheel chair, she checked and told me it was never ordered.

This could be a good airport, despite the fact it's locked in the middle of an urban area limiting its expansion and infrastructural upgrades. However the worst part is the staff: Rude! and unnecessarily so, immigration officers have a terrible attitude, I was treated like a liar. My identity had to be investigated beyond what is done at the passport control booth, and the way I was told to proceed was humiliating, everything was completed in less than two minutes and I was allowed to got home, the rudeness was a totally unnecessary extra that only eroded the expected professionalism of those officers. I hope someone will notice this problem and require them to take etiquette training. Being rude and nasty is not a synonym of efficiency.

Customer service is so rude. I approached a rep asking if where a flight was due to arrive as it was delayed and I was given a stock answer. I tried to clarify the issue i was having and was met with hostility. The agent was dismissive. Instead I was able to get my answer online using the free wifi .. staff very unhelpful.

commentHeader: Waited for hours to check in
reviewContent: Fix your lane system. Waited for hours to check in. Slow service for checking baggage in.  15 minutes per person in the queue. The US and especially Newark Airport has to fix their organizing systems. Shopping was boring,

I never thought I would find myself reviewing a TSA department but I felt compelled to after my recent positive experience. My family and I were unexpectedly transiting through Newark on June 2. We had several mishaps happen beyond our control after an extended travel day (>20 hours). The TSA department at Newark airport, in particular a man named Fontaine, helped greatly alleviate our stress and help expedite us through the security line and airport, correcting the mistakes of our airline workers. I cannot begin to tell you how appreciative I am for their help, empathy and services.

commentHeader: TSA employees were by far the worst
reviewContent: Every person I encountered there was extremely rude, but the the TSA employees were by far the worst. Super rude and disrespectful yelling at customers. Something needs to be done about the unprofessional employees there. I will not return to this airport.

I have travelled all over the world and have never experienced such rude, disrespectful staff. Bag drop was a joke, 4 ladies stood gossiping but no help whatsoever, felt like i was interupting their night out. No pleases or thank you. Might as well have lept the counter and done their jobs for them. Security was a similar experience. Someone needs to remind these people without us travellers paying exorbitant amounts for international travel they would be unemployed. Please if you are looking to breach US security fly from here, they couldnt care less. Restaurant staff however were a delight. Lots of staff here with God complex!

This airport was an insult. A 5-hour layover at Terminal B between two flights was torture. Lounges are closed or under renovation, there are too few restaurants and when I did find a somewhat acceptable spot, at the last available table, ALL healthy options were "not in stock". All they had left was overpriced fries with a burger. Spending the whole day here makes you depressed. The worst airport in a long time! I'll avoid EWR in the future and opt for JFK instead.

Just awful. Bought olive oil at duty free in Spain then I had to leave the terminal on a bus, so then had go through security again where the oil is not allowed so TSA confiscated it. Can’t even travel through New Jersey without a mess. Two hours to transfer planes and can’t take the same things from my connecting flight.

Worst major airport in the US and totally deserving of the distinction. Getting in or out of here is a challenge at every turn. I flew in and out of EWR recently and nothing went right. The AirTrain is dreadfully unreliable. On the way in it wasn’t working properly so I had to transfer trains and it took almost a half hour to get to the rail station. If the train into NYC hadn’t been delayed I would have missed it and had to wait even longer. On the way out the airtrain just stopped without explanation for 10-15 minutes leaving everyone trapped inside wondering how long we would be stuck. For $8 each way anyone would expect better for a train that only takes you 2-3 miles. The rest of the airport isn’t any better. On the way in baggage took 45 minutes and was delivered to 2 different carousels despite the boards saying it was only delivered to one. On the way out the security line was an hour. Pre check wasn’t an option, crazy in such a major airport. In short EWR is a model of inefficiency and a masterclass on how to antagonize customers at every turn.

Truly awful experience through security. My shoes did not come through scanner. When I asked where they were, 2 members of staff at belt 13/14 started to laugh, were utterly disrespectfully, just stood around for the best part of 10 minutes ignoring me. When I asked for a supervisor or airport police to attend, they ignored me again saying they didn’t think they would. Eventually they picked my shoes up from under the chair of the person who checks the monitor at the scan and placed them on the belt. Not sure if these staff have been trained or are just complete morons, but if that is how you treat your customers, then Newark is definitely an airport to avoid.

TSA failed to ensure my beige jacket was properly tucked in the security bin so it fell out and got wrapped around a roller and got completely trashed with dirty grease. This was after one TSA stated to keep my shoes and jacket on since I was TSA Pre. Another TSA told my, last minute I had to take it off.

The airport is new and looks nice but the people working here are horrible. I've been to airports all over the US, Canada, and South-East Asia and I have never experienced customer service this poor. This is my first time passing through New Jersey and I was worried that this is just how people are in New Jersey. However, after reading some of these reviews and learning that this Newark airport ranks among the worst in the country, I look forward to meeting some real New Jersians. I first observed the staff being unneccesarily confrontational with a man who didn't check a large bag. They waited until he got all the way through the line in security before reprimanding him for not checking his bag as if this large, grown man was an unruly child. Then a security lady procceded to aggressively rush the next woman in line who was travelling with 3 small children. This exchange was unapathetic and useless considering they were already going as fast as any reasonable people would. Then I got to the bag scan security area where the woman gave vague instructions in a dry tone. After i loaded my bag, emptied my pockets, and put everything in the bin she allowed it to pass into the scanner before telling me I also need to take off my shoes. When I loaded these into the bin and put it on the turnstile she pushed it back at me and told me to take my stuff out and let the next passenger load their things, because I "wasn't listening". The multiple employees I've encountered in this airport seem to all be angry at something, and its unfortunate that they are taking this out on the customers.

Had to catch a connecting flight from Canada home to Edinburgh airport. The worst airport I have ever come across for customer service - the staff are so rude and uncaring, they should move over and let people who actually want to work in customer service do the job! Border control was one of the worst experiences of my life! Only 4 desks open for a turnstile line of roughly 500 people for non USA citizens and 2 open for USA only queue of roughly 100! After queuing for 2 and half hours and very near boarding closure staff then proceeded to open the check-in point we were close to for the small USA only queue only! Answer when we tried to point out we were about to miss our flight was `see your travel rep on the other side.' Finally got through and duty free clear bag also containing my husbands personal belongings got pulled for checking behind 4 other trays, panic stricken I asked if there was anything staff could do for us as boarding closed in 3 minutes and got the response to get in line, staff then chatted away to each other giggling whilst nonchalantly re-checking the pulled trays! In the meantime, I on the other hand felt like I was about to have a heart attack with the the stress! Please put people in these jobs who actually give a damn about other people and don't get off in sneering at their customers!

commentHeader: I couldn’t fine one gluten free food
reviewContent: I couldn’t fine one gluten free food (not snack) option at any terminal! And being stuck here over night due to a cancelled flight leaves you looking for a healthy breakfast, at a minimum a breakfast sandwich! So disappointing. So many other airports are more up on the times.

There was a large line for TSA at Terminal B for the 40-47 gates. Coming down the escalator I could hear this loud yelling coming from downstairs. When I made it to the second level, an airport employee wearing a red shirt was nearly chasing people down and berating them for not keeping up with the line, the issue was, they were trying to but when they’d ask her for clarification she would get in their face and tell them to get to the back of the line if they couldn’t keep up. Then, she let 6 people cut in line in front of a patient gentleman and he asked her to please let him get back in his place and she came within inches of his face and began yelling at him saying “Do you want to do the job for me!? You wanna do the job!? Then stay in your place.” And he just simply gave up and sat down. Another employee in a blue shirt walked up to her and couldn’t even calm her down, couldn’t even get a word in. I approached and asked how to get to the TSA Pre Check line and she looked me in the eyes and laughed and then said demeaningly, “You go to the front.” I’ve never traveled through this terminal so I was confused and said “How do I get to the front?” She groaned VERY loudly and then yelled in my face “How do you think!? You walk?!” And continued to yell at me as I began walking and removing myself from the situation, I responded as I turned around already quite distanced from her but she was still yelling at me and said “Ma’am please I did nothing to you.” And she motioned to shoo me away. Multiple people were shaken up and asked if I was okay as well. It was disgusting treatment and behavior. Unfortunately I could not catch her name cause she was conveniently covering her name tag.

commentHeader: One of the worst airport experiences
reviewContent: One of the worst airport experiences out there. The redo of Terminal A is not well marked, the TSA pre security line shutdown at 7pm with over 300 people in line. The baggage service delivered 9 bags and then had a 15 minute delay until the remainder of the bags were delivered. Additionally there are several loose floor tiles, broken Sheetrock, dim lighting and general poor aesthetic throughout.

I had requested for wheelchair assistance and on departure, it was all fine. On arrivals, we were seated in the wheel chairs and left sitting for a good 10 mins. Half way to immigration, the man stopped again and told people to use the washroom and he disappeared, leaving us stranded for another 10 minutes. He reappears and wheels us into an immigration line, and what do you know, he completely stranded us. My husband had to wheel me to luggage claim, and had to wheel me separately to the taxi area, whilst he retrieved the luggage. This is the most terrible experience. The assistance is absolutely a joke. We suffered due to their lack of being properly staffed and being professionally on top of their duties.

commentHeader: worst airport experience I have ever had
reviewContent: Easily the worst airport experience I have ever had, including international airports. Not at all kid-friendly because it's not people-friendly at all. Staff can't get their story straight and are extremely rude, dirty with trash everywhere, and the airport isn't connected. We landed in terminal A and they forced us to leave the airport and go through security again to get to terminal C for our connecting flight. I guess I'm just glad our layover wasn't too short because you need a couple of hours or you'll miss you'll flight. We couldn't get to much food and felt so rushed due to having to go through security again. It would have been better to spend an extra $500 per person to have a layover in another airport. Lesson learned, we won't ever fly through here again. Oh and the so-called kid play areas are dirty, sticky, with broken pieces making it dangerous and the staff do not care at all. Seriously, just watch people and the planes, your kid will be safer and better off. Don't be like me, don't believe anyone who says this is a good airport with kids. Easily the worst part of the entire trip.

TSA agents are unhelpful and some rude and unprofessional. I left my phone at security and nobody wanted to help me and were uncaring. At the AA gate they tried to make calls to help. I borrowed a phone to call my own and was so grateful a CLEAR agent, Marquis, answered and personally walked my phone down to me so I would not miss my flight. He was so compassionate and professional - great reason to get CLEAR. I would have been devastated to lose special family pictures and will back up to cloud. He understood it was more than a phone. Rating 10 in appreciation of him and AA counter.

This is hands down the worst travel experience I’ve ever had. They have poor staffing and every flight is delayed due to not enough plane cleaners. Staff are unbothered by wait times and have very poor communication with everyone involved. The help desk is always hours long of waiting time with minimal staff. Overall very poorly managed and will never fly here again. Stay away if you value your time and money.

commentHeader: Avoid this airport at all costs
reviewContent: Horrible to get to due to ground traffic, missed connecting international flight. Leaving the next day, 3 hour delay while sitting in the plane. NEVER again do I fly here or thru here. Avoid this airport at all costs

commentHeader: Worst airport I've ever been to
reviewContent: Worst airport I've ever been to. Never again. I wont be back. So many issues i wouldnt know where to begin. In my opinion the person running this airport has no connection with the customer. Best of luck. Your going to need every ounce of it.

Absolutely appalling seeing so much chaotic scenes such as several flights cancelled or delayed by over 3 hours during the summer season! This is truly awful seeing the United Club lounge closed early in the morning. How insane is waiting for hours with no lounge access? Absolutely a nuisance and terrible management at EWR. I would avoid this airport in the future. I cannot recommend this airport.

The security service is horrible! The gentleman at the security check point very aggressively separated my clothes from my electrical equipment on the conveyor belt and threw my iPhone out of the box onto the conveyor belt which is made of metal rolls and now there is a scratch in the camera because of it. It was very unnecessary and not a good service.

commentHeader: plane to the exit is very, very long
reviewContent: My wife and I flew into the new terminal A at Newark International airport. We hated it. I am 81 and my wife is 79 and this is not a senior friendly terminal. There are no golf carts or moving platforms. The walk from the plane to the exit is very, very long. Didn't the designers think about seniors? We travel from Florida to Newark airport at least 6 times a year to visit family. The only option for seniors is a wheelchair. We are not ready for wheelchairs and it is totally degrading.

Oh dear thank goodness few airports are like this. It is in the middle of a spaghetti of roads with appalling signage. We drove 25 miles to get across the road to the hotel and on return, much the same to get in to the hotel on the airport. The Marriot hotel signs come and go and are inconsistently located. It has a dinky monorail between the parts of the airport, but no signs that tell you which way the train is going. Check in fine. No clear signage to security. Security is a mess. No thought given to a flow of space to prepare for passing through, as in room to put the trays and remove clothes, signs say to take things out of bags, then staff say to leave them in, then take off shoes and walk on a cold floor. Then no space for the trays to come through and pick up your tray, then no space to take the tray to put your stuff back on. Even most provincial airports are better laid out. Then the most pathetic duty free shopping. I sincerely hope I never need to pass this airport again. I thought Gatwick was bad but this one is the worst.

Newark has to be a contender for the worst airport in the world. We arrived at about 10 pm in the evening, planning to fly out to Belize the next day, and then returned three weeks later with an overnight stay in NYC and a flight home out of JFK. The arrival was a disaster. Customs and Immigration was overburdened with about four agents serving multiple flights. The queue lasted more than an hour and, when we finally got out, the SkyTrain service to other terminals had essentially closed down, running backwards and forwards from stops, with no apparent rhyme or rhythm. There were confused passengers everywhere and the staff on the ground could merely shrug and say this was par for the course. Efforts to get to the bus terminal to catch a coach to our hotel were also stymied by the fact that the SkyTrain was no longer going to that stop and nobody knew how to walk there. In the end, we hiked down a busy road, jumped over a concrete siding and jackrabbited through oncoming cars. Other people found a safer way, but that was purely fortuitous. Our departure to Belize the next day was no better. Horrible queues at check-in, a general lack of understanding and knowledge among ground staff and, when we finally made it to the terminal, nowhere to eat that accepted cash or cards. If you don't have a payment app on your phone, you are not getting fed in Newark. Just a terrible service all round.

The airport itself is much improved. It's no longer an empty wasteland. The lines are better than they used to be. TSA is its own thing, so I won't hold that against the airport. That said, the prices at the various restaurants are out of this world. A glass of terrible Sauvignon Blanc is $20. Some bad pizza was another $22. Candidly, I felt mocked for having paid that much for what I got. Having to do everything via QR codes is also annoying. What happened to service? As it happens, the poor staff seemed run off their feet trying to fix people's payment problems. The nice Dutch family next to me had tons of cash - but, no, Newark doesn't take cash. I mean, it's an airport - you expect a little more flexibility and service.

commentHeader: worst airport I've ever been in
reviewContent: We flew in from Brussels to connect with a flight going out to Orlando, both were United Airlines. Had to go through customs after receiving our baggage, they check our baggage. Then gave our bags back again to give to United Airlines. Went through the airport security AGAIN! Walked through the airport only to find out we were outside the back end of the airport, had to wait for a shuttle bus to take us to United Airlines departure area. Once we arrived, we had to go through security again, only to miss our flight by 6 minutes! They need to post times on how long it takes getting from one location of the airport to the other area! Due to the confusion this is the worst airport I've ever been in!

commentHeader: Will avoid Newark from here on out
reviewContent: Awful airport especially when flying United. Forced to check a bag all the way to baggage claim at final destination instead of checking to pick up at arrival gate. When flyers have chosen to just fly with a carry-on, they need to get in and out of an airport fast. Not only that but finding the rental car area is very confusing and while headed there, we received conflicting directions from airport staff. Will avoid Newark from here on out and will tell everyone I can about how messed up their checking bags at the gate is. Horrible!

Horrendous customer service at this airport. Eye-rolling, sarcasm and outright laughing at customers asking for directions to the sky train. Given erroneous directions leading to further delays in reaching ground transportation. I’ll never fly into Newark for any reason again.

I really like connecting through Newark. Transit signs are easy to follow. Transportation from one terminal to the next is easy to follow. There are plenty of places to sit down and have something to eat or drink. Yes, it is expensive but so are other airports. Yes, they use the iPads, which I think it awesome as it is so easy to order your food/drinks. Restrooms are clean and there are plenty of them. I found the staff to be very helpful and courteous. The new terminal A is beautiful with lots of natural light and great rest areas to hang out between flights. I have no complaints and have used Newark and United connecting to and from Amsterdam a few times now and will continue to do so without a problem.

commentHeader: avoid this airport in the future
reviewContent: The new terminal A looks nice, but it's not connected to the other terminals. They require multiple busses to transport thousands of passengers between terminals for a simple local connection. It's so idiotic. I'll avoid this airport in the future.

commentHeader: horrible and so sad to see iPad's everywhere
reviewContent: Its horrible and so sad to see iPad's everywhere. People looked like robots. No one is talking to each other. TV's everywhere with sound loud at gate C130. I couldn't even have a menu on a paper. Never served because I didn't want to use the iPad. Toilet were not well cleaned. Make people connect together please. Prices on things so expensive.

Horrible! United staff was rude, as were the TSA folks. I’m a retired cop, and if I ever treated people like that I would been investigated by Internal Affairs. Worst airport that I have traveled through.

commentHeader: will never fly through Newark again
reviewContent: We flew into Newark airport as a layover from LAX to Paris. Originally we had a 3 hour layover. The plane was 3 hours late. We had to run through Newark airport from one gate to another in the same terminal. However, when we got to the next set of gates, there was another security checkpoint with a huge line. We have never had to go through security again when switching from one flight to another in the same airport and we have traveled all over the world. There were hundreds of people in line and they were already boarding our flight. Our daughter had flown in from another airport earlier and was on the other side texting us. I asked the airport staff member near me about the line and told her that my plane was boarding. She said all of these people's planes are boarding. The airline would come get me. (Really? When do airlines come get someone out of a security line?) She said I could ask the people in line to go ahead of them. There were hundreds. We went further down in line asking everyone if we could please go ahead. At one point we followed a desperate French girl who was begging her way through. We finally got through and they held our luggage. They ran my husband's carry-on back through the machine. My carry-on just sat there on a table. I asked the staff behind the glass to please help me. Could they please check my bag because my plane was boarding. They ignored me. They ignored my husband. Complete, absolute deafness. We were not being rude. I was really begging in desperation at this point - almost in tears at the stress and frustration of the situation. Nothing. My husband got angry when another staff member came through and the girls hugged and laughed and chatted as they continued to ignore us and our luggage! He yelled saying, "I know you can hear me! You need to check the luggage and give it to us!" My husband has traveled all over the world in all sorts of conditions his entire life. He has never gotten like this in an airport, no matter how frustrating things can be. I told him to go on to the gate. One of the staff members finally grabbed my bag and would not speak to me or have eye contact. She was muttering about rude people telling her how to do her job. She swabbed the hand warmers that I had that were still in the original packaging and wanted to know why I had them. "To keep my hands warm in Europe." These went through LAX, Paris, Barcelona, Mallorca, and Venice on this trip without one person questioning them! My luggage was never stopped anywhere else. Every person at this airport was rude. I am not exaggerating. We flew back in from Paris 2 weeks later and the signage is not very good. We couldn't tell where to go for ground transportation - hotel shuttles. My husband stopped to ask someone and the staff member just kept yelling at everyone "Just go through the doors!" He was very rude to everyone. Once we went through the unlabled doors, there was signage. It would have been helpful before! When we got to the transport trains to go to another terminal to catch the shuttle, the female staff member was yelling at everyone about train directions. This was not just projecting her voice to be heard. She was rude and sarcastic and yelling. The instructions were so complicated and she was so rude that we just left the train area and went to get a taxi. It was worth the money to get out of that airport! We will never fly through Newark again.
Seriously - the worst ever airport. 3rd world countries have better facilities than this joke of an airport. TSA slower by far than a regular line. Terrible infrastructure.

commentHeader: has to be the worst airport
reviewContent: This has to be the worst airport in USA. Who design or is in charge of the shuttles systems (to Terminals A and B)? A disastrous way to move people to one place to another. No organization, no help, a rudiments system with employees screaming to people…you name it. Where is the government accountability?  Worst of all: if you tried to submit a complaint it fails. There’s no way (and I tried many times) to get one pass through. To the people in charge, do something.

Arrogant dumb and slow TSA. Transit in the same terminal should not be as complicated and we should not do the processes twice. It is such an inefficient airport. Bad use of human resources. Few water fountains and no place to fill bottes of water. Not enough sitting spaces and places to wait apart blocking the hallway. Do better Newark.
The worst airport in the USA, And it's mostly the staff. The worst TSA staffing there is. Rude, unhelpful, slow.

commentHeader: the worst airport I have ever been in
reviewContent: This is the worst airport I have ever been in, the fact we had to take a shuttle from C to A. I always go to gate I fly out of to eat because it’s closer. C had lots of options to eat and restaurants. We come to A via the map to see what was there and we had to wait in security all over in a long line! Ridiculous. I have 2 children. I’ve been to a tons of airports this is insane. By the time we go through I may not be able to even feed my kids… just asinine. Will never fly into here again.

commentHeader: the worst airport I've ever flown into and out of
reviewContent: This airport is the worst airport I've ever flown into and out of. When departing it was total chaos at the security checkpoint and when arriving the staff were rude and unprofessional. I will never use this airport again.

commentHeader: EWR sets the bar really low
reviewContent: I am not sure you can experience a worst airport than EWR … and even though it probably exists, EWR sets the bar really low! Imagine a facility built in the late 70s that was never upgraded to todays travel standards and cannot accommodate basic needs … even bathrooms that went through fairly recent renovations are a disaster and filthy! Avoid! JFK and newly renovated LGA are much better options for NYC.

I haves lived in NJ my whole life and unfortunately EWR has been my go to airport. All I will say is even with the renovations they never fixed the staff problem. Nobody seems to value their job or have a clue what customer service is. I usually don't review but this is more of a warning than complaint. Every-time I am in terminal C and try to use the food court to order something I almost never get my food because it took too long, they forgot, can't even find anyone to ask, or this time completely ignored. I stood there for 30 min when I got a text that my meal was ready and no one even acknowledged me. I finally just gave up and boarded my flight.

A stressful experience with check-in and security. Both of which I was encountered with two rude staff members. I understand that all airports are stressful at this point in time. But the rude comments from the staff were unnecessary, considering I had never been to Newark airport. I don’t usually post reviews.

I will avoid having to do anything through Newark Intl in future. I live in Brooklyn, but rented a car for travel in New Jersey, picking up from Newark International airport (EWR). It is already a painful experience to get to EWR on public transport where there is only one train an hour from Penn Station in Manhattan on Sundays. The last leg to the rental place is the Air Train which literally takes almost 30 minutes to go from one end of the airport to the other and stops for 5 minutes at each terminal and makes multiple delay stops on the tracks. Why? I missed my return train to NYC as a consequence. I saw many other frustrated travelers as well. When raising this with the customer service attendant at the station she basically smirked at me and told me to leave a review on Google. Her complete indifference was infuriating and amplified a general attitude of complacency which makes having anything to do with this airport undesirable. Do better Newark.

commentHeader: I'm so disgusted by how I was treated
reviewContent: I have never been treated so rudely by an airport employee for politely trying to ask a question. I'm guessing she treats many people this way but nobody confronts her because they just want to get going. I would probably do the same thing but she and two male employees had just finished boarding a flight to Toronto so when I asked her a question about my gate # she totally snapped at me and I told her "don't speak to me like that", she became even ruder and when I asked to speak to a manager nobody would do anything, the two men stood there while she told them not to help me and I asked them are you seriously going to do nothing? They looked at me and I told them how shameful they were. I'm so disgusted by how I was treated. I took her picture, it was gate B-52. Newark airport should be embarrassed and mortified by some of the reviews I'm now reading.

commentHeader: line for the security check was lengthy
reviewContent: 2 big issues with Newark Airport Terminal C: 1: The line for the security check was lengthy as the airport was busy however they used the qeue to needlessly walk back and forth amongst other travelers even though half of that time there was not a backup so walking back and forth full speed as others passed by at full speed, needlessly exposing passengers to possible covid from others. 2: lets face it the restaurants are all using an inferior system for ordering and paying. Yes having to click on a qr code for a menu has become pretty mainstream during the covid years. However the system is unable to read a credit card. So patrons have to enter their name on the card, the card number, expiration and security code each and every time the patron wishes to order an additional item. Really? the system can not read a credit card, venmo or other? Time to look to replace the system as soon as possible, this is costing you sales as people are walking away.

I was appalled, and my husband too. We just could not believe that as tired as we were we could not order a meal or a drink without having to use a screen. The worst was when we witnessed an elderly couple asking if they could see an actual paper menue. The employee rudley told them "no, it's not available." The husband tried to pull out his phone from his pocket and I saw how his hand was shaking as if he seemed to have some kind of disorder like Parkinsons. It's elder abuse, we thought.

commentHeader: do as little work as possible
reviewContent: I requested a wheelchair to take me to the gate. After nearly an hour of waiting (and nearly missing my plane), and repeated requests, and several people now waiting for chairs, two women appear on the horizon pushing empty wheelchairs and walking so slowly they might have been standing still. Finally she pushes me towards the screening area where there are three lines of people waiting to go through. One line has only one person waiting for the agent to approve their ticket/ID to go through screening. She gets on that line but just as the person in front of us goes through (we would be next), she switches lines that has more people in front of us. As that line goes down and we're about to go through, she switches again to a longer line. And now my boarding time is only a few minutes away. I turn to her and ask why are we switching lines? "Stop yelling at me," is her reply (and no, I wasn't yelling). Clearly this woman's goal is to do as little work as possible. Pretty sure that's the goal at Newark Airport as a whole.

commentHeader: worst airport I have ever been to
reviewContent: This is the worst airport I have ever been to. The staff is rude, uncooperative, stupid, and dismissive. I tried to be as pleasant as I could but every single person I spoke with had no idea what was going on and caused massive delays. This was an absolute disaster and I will never come back to this airport again. In 5 different airports in the last 10 days and all of them were amazing except for Newark. It's the worst airport of my life.

The terminal signage is absolutely lacking. No indication which terminal you are currently in anywhere. Signage for shuttle transport to alternate terminals is literally barely visible and at knee height. Passengers look up for signage and directions not at knee level. Seating areas are filthy as well. Zoom under the seats of the pic I took attached herein

commentHeader: The system is an abomination and unjust
reviewContent: Who decided to create the ridiculous business model for bars, restaurants and food services? The system is an abomination and unjust both to workers and customers. I will not be flying through Newark as long as this atrocity persists. You have $600 ipads placed everywhere which only give a QR code. It is the only way to way to order food and drinks, but internet cannot keep up with the demand. The internet is spotty at best requiring a crazy amount of time to just place an order. And for those customers who can use it, the system lures them into a false sense of security that their food and drink will be delivered in normal fashion. Yet, I witnessed numerous customers wait more than 30 minutes for drinks, more than 45 minutes for food, and then, without orders ever being delivered, have to fight for reimbursement or lose money due to their flight schedule. We cannot tip for good service and in general customers receive lousy service because workers are forced to contend with a system that fosters anger with both customers and workers. Don't even get me started with plastic being used everywhere, creating more harm for the environment. All of this is a cost-cutting measure to serve the wealthy elite who care nothing local workers. I am appalled at such an horrific system that removes convenience, friendliness and expedience. Those at the top approving this should be fired.

commentHeader: Really disappointed and won’t be back
reviewContent: I have just spent a few hours at the airport and am really disappointed at the lack of food, beverage and shopping available. My husband and I had a beer each at one of only two palaces to sit and eat available and it cost us $26? This is an extortionate amount to pay for a beer in a plastic glass.  Shocking to think that an international airport has nothing to buy apart from souvenirs. You can’t even try the perfumes on as there are no testers available. Really disappointed and won’t be back.

I cannot praise the assistance that my husband and I received at Newark Airport highly enough. The wheelchair was waiting for us when we left the plane and our guide accompanied us to get our luggage, through check in for our next flight, through security and to our lounge without a hitch and with cheerfulness. Fantastic service!

commentHeader: don't have a clue how to organize
reviewContent: Check in is a nightmare, self check in seemed to be the only option, no assistance what so ever. Then at bag drop off, the staff were as unfriendly as rude, very disappointed, at security the staff just dont know how to control the influx of passengers, directed from one place to another, everything taken out of bag and put into the boxes, when you ask about passport and docs, get told that you keep them with you only until you have to pass through the scanner then you get told go and put it back in a box. These people don't have a clue how to organize. Being a traveller to various places around the world, Newark will not see me if i can help it.

I have flown out of this airport twice in the last month. It is crowded, security lines are long, and departures and arrival traffic is insane, and so disorganized. Waiting spaces are crowded and the staff seemed to angry to be there. I hate having to fly out of here.

Horrible experience. Staff super rude, not only with us but also with other passengers simply asking for information. We were all treated so badly. I have travelled the world, and I honestly don’t remember this type of treatment anywhere else. In addition, my husband and I were unable to access to the lounge (despite having a priority pass membership), as we were told that this was only allowed in Terminal B (we were in Terminal C). Finally, our flight was delayed by one hour. If you can choose, please don’t choose this airport.

commentHeader: They literally sell fifteen kinds of water in this spirit
reviewContent: They literally sell fifteen kinds of water in this spirit and no sparkling. None. All these “different” kinds of water are marketing ripoffs. Surely you could manage a perion somewhere in there. One damn bottle. Also not a bag of pretzels. Three hundred kinds of the same thing is not choice. Come on!

commentHeader: took over 1hr to check us in
reviewContent: This is the worst airport ever! I never had such a terrible experience as I had yesterday. I was flying out for vacation with my family. I arrived at the airport before 5:00am for an 8am flight with united airlines. Due to a lack of staff because of Covid, they took over 1hr to check us in because of a system issue. I had to wait in a long line at customs and when I got to my gate, the gate was closed! They told me that there was a 10am flight that I could possibly get to if I would go to customer service. When I got to customer service, they gave me standby tickets and told me the flight would be delayed until 2pm. I waited all day for them to tell me that the flight was full! I am highly upset, I did not even go on my vacation. They told me to try for another flight for the next day which would be a red eye, but that was completely pointless since my vacation was only 5 days long.

commentHeader: poorest airport I have ever departed from
reviewContent: I have flown all over the world, & Newark is simply the poorest airport I have ever departed from. Security was chaotic, understaffed & judging by the equipment, lacked investment. The departure lounge has insufficient seating, no defined queuing areas, is massively overcrowded, has no facilities, is far too hot, & the PA system can't be heard over the noise. In short it is a complete shambles. New York/New Jersey authorities should be utterly ashamed & embarrassed by such a poor, dysfunctional airport. I have experienced far superior airports in countries with GDP's less than that of New York.

Fly here if you want to deal with rude TSA workers. I understand working in customer service can be a huge pain but there was no professionalism in anyone until I got on the plane. Also walking through the airport every worker looked like they hate their lives and the airport.

Avoid this place. We had a reasonable 38 minute layover at Terminal 3, with both flights on the same big airline. Newark Facilities couldn't figure out how to connect the terminal ramp to the normal plane, so our deplaning was delayed about 10 minutes. We hustled to the gate of our connecting flight and arrived 8 minutes early. Only to find no one there and the plane gone, while the sign said "Now Boarding Zone 3". No announcements about boarding were heard on the fast trot there. Customer Service tells us Newark Facilities (the same clowns that delayed our deplaning) ordered our connecting flight to leave early. Thus between 4.30 to 9.20pm, we were stuck at this place. Good size terminal with many shops, but nowhere to sit down and order a nice dinner from a human and relax. The few shops that sold food, sold the same 12 items or so, at every place. Nothing healthy and nothing gluten free, which we need, just the exact 12 things everywhere. If we wanted to buy chips (potato, Fretos, Doritos, etc.), they had 1000's of options to choose from, but the opposite for every other type of food - it was ridiculous. As a captive market we expect to be gouged at an airport, but this place was by far and away the biggest gouger - triple most airports. $24 for a simple mixed drink, $17 for a small re-made salad or sandwich. No humans to order from, just the same kiosks everywhere, half of which didn't work.

commentHeader: a nice airport with lots of amenities
reviewContent: Newark Airport is underrated - if you know what you're doing. To most travelers, EWR is a very confusing airport with lots of (not so great connections) around the airport. However, once you get the hang of things, EWR is a nice airport with lots of amenities. Getting there, parking is very open most of the time, and most of the time you have to either book 24hrs in advance or go to Short Term parking. They accept multiple forms of payment such as EZ-Pass and credit cards (Terminal C accepts Cash). Getting there on train is also convenient from the city as NJTransit operates to Newark every 15-30 minutes from NY Penn Station. The AirTrain could be down occasionally, so make sure you have time to get to the terminal before your flight. About terminals, Terminal C and B have adequate facilities and places to shop. Terminal A however, is being torn down to make way for Terminal 1 in the future. Terminal A is one of the most dated terminals there is, and I would only recommend flying out of it unless you HAVE to (i.e JetBlue, United Express, Air Canada etc.). Security can be very slow at times at Terminal A (especially during busy hours). Terminal B is the international terminal. This terminal is somewhat dated, however, is way better than Terminal A. Customs are relatively quick here, never had an issue getting through. The last terminal (and where most of EWR's travelers go through) is Terminal C. Terminal C is the best terminal at current hands down. United has modernized this terminal to fit the needs of the modern traveler. The TSA process can be from what I experienced to be anywhere from 5-20 minutes, which isn't that bad. Be warned though, prices do get steep here in terms of retail options and dining options. There is very little cheap food options (besides the Wendy's and Dunkin Donuts, or the Starbucks pre-security), so if you want a good meal, be prepared to shell out some extra cash. Getting to any gate at Terminal C is relatively easy, as if you don't need to walk, there's buggies driving around taxing people through crowds to get to gates. (don't forget to tip them!). So in short from this review, if you're going in Newark, if the trip is a couple bucks extra going out of Newark on United in Terminal C, do it. Terminal C will be your greatest for connections, as well as overall amenities.

It appears that Newark Airport vendors are set up to horribly disappoint, if not anger, all travelers with reasonable expectations surrounding price, customer service, transparency, consistency and quality. Let's start with prices. One expects prices to be higher than normal in an airport but Newark has determined to outdo all other airports and even NFL stadiums in this category. $25 for a gin and tonic, $15 for a breakfast burrito (a marginal one at that) are examples of prices experienced. Convenience store items like snacks are priced similarly, knowing that no one would purchase if the price was visible, you never know the price until you check out. I had the pleasure of ordering breakfast at the Grand Bazaar (fancy name for food court). Order food on the tablet, then you are told to go pay elsewhere. Go to another tablet in a different area and pay (with a horribly convoluted process if you are given food vouchers which obviously won't cover the full price of your meal). You are given the option of "no receipt" which most opt for (luckily not I) as when you return to where you ordered your food you are required to present proof of payment. I saw that happen a half dozen times in less than 15 minutes. After waiting a very long time, I asked about my order (having already provided proof of payment when called earlier) and was told she could see my order. Interestingly, a container with my order number was sitting right next to her which I pointed out and they then assembled my order. I have to say, McDonalds breakfast burritos are far superior in taste to the one I got. For starters, it mainly consisted of about 6 eggs worth of unseasoned scrambled eggs with part of a sausage link cut up with a couple of small pieces of bell pepper and onion. It came with a side of cut up potatoes with no options for condiments to add flavor. With a career in retail, I've never seen a misalignment of personnel, product and process as bad as this.

The worst airport or transit location of any kind I have ever been to period. Unhelpful staff watched idly by as myself and other travelers struggled to figure out directions, signage, procedures and hours on our own. Extremely poor seating, especially pre-check in. Not disability or elderly friendly. TSA entrance was not properly labeled and I waited for 3 hours sitting on the floor in the wrong area, along with 5 other travelers before anyone told us TSA was open in another area. Disabled people, the elderly and families with children were treated terribly and not given proper attention or treatment. There is a horrible disconnect between all airport staff and no one knows anything or are withholding info and making fun of travelers. Bathrooms were not maintained with broken doors and bodily fluids everywhere. No proper security or safety measures. No enforcement of Covid-19 protocols with many, many travelers not wearing masks. Will never be traveling here again.

commentHeader: Never in my life had I experienced such vile behavior
reviewContent: Was only in Newark for transit, had to go through Secondary Passport check just for having a UK passport even after stating I had not been in the UK for over a year. TSA staff in the passport check room were absolutely vile, not to me personally but I had to see how denigrating they were to other passengers, screaming at them, making fun of them to their faces, laughing out loud every time they would deny someone entry to the US as if they got a thrill from it. Never in my life had I experienced such vile behavior, the abuse of power is very clear. Will avoid at all cost ever having to go through Newark Airport again, the experience was honestly traumatizing. There is a special place in hell for the 3 TSA agents I saw that day in the secondary passport check office.

commentHeader: Most of the staff are arrogant and rude
reviewContent: I get it. It’s exhausting working with people, but damn! Most of the staff are arrogant and rude! I’m not asking for the staff to have a smile on their face, have some courtesy. I love New Jersey, but this airport sucks!

commentHeader: I was totally disgusted with this experience
reviewContent: I travel across the globe and this has to be one of the worst airports for lack of customer service, arrogant and aloof staff and a general staff feeling of I don't care less. What is in the water there? Dirty, escalators out of service, rude employees, crowded and the "restaurant" prices are outrageous. I have seen 3rd world airports where I have been better treated and surrounded by a better atmosphere. What a way to be greeted in the NY area. Someone needs to teach their employees manners and a way to interact with the world that isn't so abrasive and "I don't care attitude. I was totally disgusted with this experience and will try my hardest to avoid this airport at all costs in the future. Now to be fair, the airline staff do not fall into this category but the local folks that have contact with the public need some real work. Perhaps it is a cultural thing here, regardless it isn't comfortable.

This has to be the rudest airport ever. TSA pre paying passengers fair warning, they still make you take your shoes off, empty your backpacks, yell at you in front of your children, remove your belt, and cell phones out of your purses. We were even told “We don’t care if your TSA Pre, remove everything”!! Fly somewhere else.

I waited for over 1/2 hour for a wheelchair which never came. I then had to walk the length of the terminal and stand in line for security. After that I had to walk to the end of the wing to the last gate. By the time I got to the gate I was doubled over in pain. This is not a handicap friendly airport!

commentHeader: TSA is by far the worst in the history of all jobs created!
reviewContent: TSA is by far the worst in the history of all jobs created! Used my wife to train a new hire, I understand they random check bags but, they left her in a room alone for twenty minutes, went through her bags again. She is standing there begging for them to let her get on her flight and the woman from TSA says, I don't care if you miss your flight! You people are by far the most overpaid disrespectful people in all the world!!

commentHeader: What social distancing in a pandemic
reviewContent: 6 or 7 International flights came in all at once. Luggage was lumped on 2 separate carousels. TSA lines were terrible! What social distancing in a pandemic, TSA is rude and unprofessional and need to be fired! I had 10 minutes to my next flight and was detained unnecessarily because I spoke up and told them I was late. I was searched in front of everyone as punishment for saying I was going to be late. Train your staff. I am a seasoned world traveler and to be treated this way is disgusting!

commentHeader: TSA agents are rude and inconsiderate
reviewContent: Every time I fly through here it is bad. TSA agents are rude and inconsiderate and treat pro travelers the same as first time flyers. I have global entry with TSA Pre and got yelled at for my laptop. Rather that. Be professional to a business flyer they yelled at me and made me wait even longer. Fly into JFK or LaGuardia.

I have been travelling for over 25 years. Worst experience of an airport I have ever encountered. The drive in was bad, the TSA employees are rude, and the Security lines are disorganized. Never mind about being TSA approved, it means nothing in this airport. Then there is the walk into the terminal. Federal mandate says you have to wear a mask. They should take a look at the condition of the Filthy common areas. The floors are disgusting, the bathrooms are makeshift bathrooms you would see for the homeless. Nothing is open no lounge no bars. Everyone that works there is either on their phones or just have no intentions of doing anything. Truly a free ride. This place is disgusting. It looks like a Third World holding pen in here.

commentHeader: this airport truly is one you don’t deserve to experience
reviewContent: Avoid this airport at all costs! The worst at everything you can imagine. $30+ for a philly sandwich, ($22+ for a cocktail), re-check through security to travel between terminals, mind numbingly inept and careless employees in security, food or any other service you can imagine. Dirty and disgusting everything and an international terminal so run down that it has to be an embarrassment for the airport authority. I don’t normally write reviews, but this airport truly is one you don’t deserve to experience.

Is this the new normal? Gouging for overpriced food. Everything is automated which is nice if service and product is good but no one to complain to when you buy $40 terrible meal and sit at a filthy table. If the A/C is turned on I’m not impressed. Sitting here sweating eating overpriced garbage food at a table that no one ever cleans. Can’t wait to get to a foreign airport where they take some pride in their spaces. Way to go Newark!

The terminal was disgusting. The tables were filthy! I was required to wear a mask yet it looked as if the floors and tables hadn’t been cleaned in days. Lots of staff members sitting on their phones. This may be the worst airport terminal I’ve seen thus far.

commentHeader: terminal has a large number of food offering
reviewContent: I arrived in terminal C, which was United's flagship hub. The terminal has a large number of food offerings and was very clean. After I dined, however, I began having issues. My next flight was out of terminal B, which meant I had to use the AirTrain. Unbeknownst to me, I had to clear security again, which had me rushing to my gate. I later found out that I could have taken the shuttle, however, the employees at terminal C never mentioned it. After making my way into terminal B, I had to walk around security multiple times, as it looked as if the checkpoint was closed, even though it was opened. I had just managed to make my flight on time, even after the gate agent told me that I needed to buy a KN95 mask, which Newark sells for 20 dollars. Beware of the mask policies - US airlines allow any cloth mask, but EU airlines demand a medical one. EWR is a great airport for a long connection, especially terminal C. I would not recommend this airport for a short connection, especially if a terminal change is required.

commentHeader: possibly the worst airport in the world
reviewContent: This is possibly the worst airport in the world. Limited food, nothing open, Prices are 2 to 4 times higher than any other airport. No place to get any type of meal I would highly recommend that this airport be bulldozed.

commentHeader: crammed into this place like an ant hill
reviewContent: It is impossible for me to conceive how any authority would allow this airport to operate as it does while there's a virus going around. People are crammed into this place like an ant hill everywhere. Checkin lines are out if control. It took us 10 minutes fighting through crowds to get upstairs to the business check-in. Security lines especially after you retrieve your carry on bags from the belt are just plain in your face unsafe. Again, anthill. While thick crowds shuffle through, people sit in the middle of the walkways with masks off because they're at a bar. How is this ok? Avoid.

I had an unnecessary stressful situation today at the Newark. I had my bag held for at least 20 minutes because I had a tub of lysol wipes. There was 10 bags ahead of mine, the person checking the bags was by herself doing it. I tried to talk to her that I would miss my flight if I had to wait for all those bags. Her answer I will get to it when I get to it. So after waiting impatiently she finally gets to my bag to only grab my thin tube of lysol wipes and wipe it with something and give me my bag. I had to sprint run to my gate. I mean where do you guys hire such insensitive people? Why do other businesses care about customer service and you don't? Do you offer any training to your employees or do you just take them off the street and put them to work? If you want to be checking bags for unreasonable reason then hire more people and educate them.

We were flying home from a weekend in New Jersey on Sunday, November 15, 2020. We arrived around noon for a 3:00 pm flight on United Airlines. The disorganization and chaos was something out of a movie. Nobody at United knew where to go, the lines were out the door, and the employees seemed lost. Nobody was able to answer questions. One guy (not with us) was yelling out loud for someone from United Airlines to please assist with the chaos. We had my grandsons who are 7 and 5 years old. Thank goodness they were patient because it took us over 100 minutes to check in and check our bags. I have never in all my years experienced anything like it. I had TSA recheck on my boarding pass and the lady acted like she didn’t know where it was. I went through the regular line to avoid more problems. (on another note, I flew home on October 12 from here and the TSA precheck was CLOSED. People were livid! Why do we close that on a busy Sunday?) United Airlines should take most of the blame for this but Newark gets a little also. It was awful! We grabbed a quick bite before the flight and paid $36 for a salad and a small soda.  I certainly hope someone sees this and does something about it. Thank you!
Dirty Terminal A, almost nasty. TSA precheck were bumbling around, fumbling with bags on the belt, standing around chatting with each other and basically not paying attention. True amateur hour.

Water vending machines needed after security.  All stores obviously closed due to COVID. Pass the security only a water fountainis available. Is that hygienic considering the rate at which the virus keeps spreading?  There are 2 vending machines that sell electronics. Please exchange those for a water one! In the meantime, bring an empty bottle of water with you.

Worst experience ever. I had a long lay over and wanted to go to a lounge in a different concourse but was unable too. Every time you go to a different concourse you have to go back through security if they let you. They prescribe your tickets and if you are set for a different concourse they block you. I will never go through here again.

commentHeader: I want to change this policy of separating family
reviewContent: I was travelling with my family for a vacation. This is the first time we encountered the barking dog security check and it was horrible. My son was sniffed by the dog and was asked to step aside by the security as we the rest of the family was standing there. I had to walk beside the barking dog and was asked to come back to the starting place to walk again with the dog. My son was taken by a cop to another scanning area when we the three of the family were standing in another area for checking. Why couldn't they take all of us together when we were travelling together. He was terrified so were the rest of the family. We couldn't see him. After we were checked in the cop brought him to us. My son said he was scared. Please stop this practice. I want to change this policy of separating family for additional checking.

This airport was horrible. Stopped here for a connecting flight home from London. Most of the staff were absolutely awful. This was only my second time flying and my mother’s first. Staff did not acknowledge us or attempt to help us, when we asked they acted like we were a bother to them. The customs person checking passports and boarding passes snatched my phone from me to scan my boarding pass. The woman in TSA had a major attitude and got mad when we told her that the bins under the table that she said were empty actually had stuff in them. I was in a great mood after my vacation but the staff at this airport ruined it completely. The staff at London Heathrow, Richmond International, Dulles, and Dubai International airports were never rude and disrespectful like this. It’s a shame, honestly, that first and second time travelers, let alone anyone at all, should have to be treated like this and made to feel dumb.

commentHeader: I'd still rather fly here than to LaGuardia
reviewContent: I flew into Terminal A and out of Terminal C the next day, both on United Express. Unfortunately, it can be difficult to leave the airport on public transit on the weekend because NJ Transit schedules 3 trains within 15 minutes of each other, then makes you wait 45 minutes for the next one. For that reason, I reluctantly shelled out for a Lyft into New York. I really appreciated that Newark lets you get into Lyft vehicles directly at the curbside - too many airports these days make you walk long distances to a distant parking garage to get your ride, but Newark's customer-friendly decision to let me get picked up at the curb meant that I could be on my way within 10 minutes of arriving, for which I give them high marks. Departing out of Terminal C was a little more hectic, the signage for how to get to security from the check-in desks was inadequate, and the employees who were supposed to be directing traffic were rude when asked for assistance. The food in Terminal C was overpriced, but I thought the quality was actually decent, and I liked the ability to order food on a tablet at the gate and get it delivered. Newark isn't great, and I wish the public transit powers that be would spread the trains out a little more so that there aren't 45 minutes wait for trains. But I'd still rather fly here than to LaGuardia.

Used Newark as a connection on my way back from London. What an embarrassment. Terrible systems in place for international travel. Filthy dirty with trash everywhere. Food is very overpriced. I will pay extra to avoid this airport in the future. I've been in a lot of American airports and this is the worst by far.

commentHeader: never, ever again use this airport
reviewContent: I fly the world over and still can’t believe the free market has not eliminated this underperforming airport. Hard to believe there is no dedicated custom for people with connections nor do they have a dedicated security line for connecting flight. I am skipping comments to the airline which was as blatantly not caring or competent. Promised myself to never, ever again use this airport.

Every time I come here the waiting area is at least 78 degrees, much too hot to wait for an hour for a flight. Searched all areas of the gate area and not one cool spot. Very restricted food and drink availability at the gate area. Only one restaurant one snack bar. If you are hungry eat before you come to this gate. Bathrooms are clean! Severe need for an upgrade. Very out dated and dirty looking terminal.

I am disgusted by the experience my husband and I had at Newark airport this morning. Our flight was scheduled to leave at 6am, so we arrived a little after 4am. We breezed through check-in at the Delta counter with zero issues. Everyone was kind, professional, working efficiently, and quickly checked our bags in, printed our boarding passes, and directed us to security. A quick trip up the escalator and we were “greeted” with an enormously, annoyingly excessive long security line. Though the electronic signboard stated the minute-long wait for TSA pre-check, priority boarding, and regular, they informed us all lanes were closed but “regular.” This was was the first major slow down. Next, there was a large number of TSA agents per customers, the majority were dry, cold, and lacked professional courtesy/basic customer service (and some were just straight up rude) as they pushed people through this single lane and barked repetitive reminders about the speed in which to walk past the dog, etc. We are frequent flyers and have seen many other airports use the police dogs much more effectively than Newark. Why can’t they take a page out of JFK’s or DCA’s policy and just keep the line moving at a normal pace and have a lane for the dog to pass everyone? This was the second major slow down. We finally get to our security scan belt around 535am, knowing our flight is already boarding. They switch out TSA people to watch the screen, which stops our line. They yell over and over that nothing may be in a bin except large electronics and edibles. Again, the cold, curt way in which we were spoken to was unacceptable. We finally make it to the scanner and I’m randomly selected for additional screening. That didn’t take as long as I thought it might, but again, I’m now fearful I’m going to miss my flight that takes off in 15 min. No one cares. That was the third slowdown. We get through security to then be yelled at to take our shoes to a bench to put them back on... why can’t anyone show a bit of kindness???? Meanwhile, nearly everyone was passing, in front of or behind, us complaining about how horrible security was today. Why would they not open until 430am knowing people are scheduled to board 6am departing flights at 530? We made our flight but did get to the gate after boarding had already begun. I will be doing everything in my power to avoid the Newark airport for future travel and will tell my friends and family to do the same.

Departed and arrived at this airport for an international flight. Signage is terrible. Services such as restaurants while waiting are extremely limited. But the worst part was upon return getting through border control and customs. Landed early after a 10-hour flight and got in the line for US citizens. There were only 2 agents working. This for a place where planes carrying hundreds of passengers land. After nearly an hour we went past the agents to the machines to scan our passports and answer customs questions, when we had already filled out a form on the plane. We then had to get in another line to see another officer and this line also only had 2 officers working. We were part of a group trip and noticed nobody that had been in line ahead of us or behind us was in this new line. We noticed that no one else in the new line we were in held US Passports. We asked if we were in the right place and were told to stay in line with no explanation as to why. When we finally got to the officer he told us it was bad luck and scanned our passports. Nobody actually ever looked at the customs form. It took us two hours to get through customs and to our baggage. Terrible service. Will never fly through Newark again.

We ended up on a United flight following the collapse of Thomas Cook who we had a flight booked with into JFK. Having travelled into JFK many times before I was comparing my experience in Newark to JFK. On arrival signage was clear and there were no queues for immigration. Only the queue that formed from our plane. Staff were pleasant and helpful in contrast to the rude staff at JFK. Baggage collection was fine and we were out of the airport within 40 minutes from arrival. This was at 12.00 pm on a Tuesday afternoon. Returning we found the check in quite confusing but we had plenty of help. There was a reasonably long but fast moving security queue and staff were serious but polite. Really liked the food ordering iPads and the free use of iPads in the departure lounge. Really nice feature. The food and drink outlets were very expensive. All in all a good experience and much better than JFK and I’d use United again next time I go back to New York.

commentHeader: security is always a big drama
reviewContent: Flew Newark a couple of time for domestic and international flights. It is a descent airport with aged facilities. Queuing for security is always a big drama, which is common for us airports. However Newark is pretty horrible in this regard, especially for international flight. That's why I try to avoid this airport as possible as i can. EWR ranks definitely last among new York airports.

A very average airport in term of quality of infrastructures and cleanliness. Will need to be modernized in the near future. But overall, the biggest problem with this airport (and other in USA) is the people who work there. Many give more attention to consulting their phone during work time rather than offering a quality service to the passengers! The security staff of TSA are unprofessional, not dedicated to their work, rude and not fit to work with people. It gives a strong impression that the main criteria to work for TSA is to be a loser.

Posted signs and directions are the least useful I have ever seen. No clear direction to rental car, air train, or even what airlines are supported at what gates. Asking airport staff results in attitude. TSA lines are ridiculous, and attitude of TSA staff is horrible. TSA exit provides for only three seats to allow travlers space to re-pack and put on shoes. There is plenty of room for additional seating, just none provided. Restrooms - thought I was in a third world country. Semi permanent outhouse? Complete with queue like TSA? Totally ridiculous. If/when you actually get into one, it is filthy. Terminal - gate area, wide open, good seating, but not one flight monitor. I'm sorry, but if the e-ticket does not provide gate number, and the gate area provides no monitors, you are forced to stand in line to ask at a random gate station about other gate info. Once again - large amount of attitude.

This airport really is pretty awful. Overcrowded, generally surly staff, not enough restrooms. At least it is generally clean. I arrived from an international destination a few years back and never again. Try finding a Lufthansa code share and connect in Frankfurt or Munich instead. This is a United hub so I connect here occasionally but try to avoid it. Overcrowded and tired United Clubs. I think I will start using LaGuardia once the construction there is complete. It really is pretty bad.

Avoid this airport when flying international and allow at least 3+ hours for changing flights as the queues at immiagration hall were horrendous with so many agents booths unoccupied, surely they know when to put more agents on with the number of international flights arriving. It took me two hours to clear immigration, had a departing flight with United from terminal C so planned to use United shuttle bus at gate 67 which means you don't have to go through security. When i went to recheck my bag in the belt had broken so they were using buses to terminals where you had to carry your baggage onto and as i was now out of the terminal had to clear security again at terminal C causing further delay, i ran to the gate and my flight was just boarding. Staff here are rude and don't answer any questions, signage is very poor and on returning gate signage was wrong sending me the wrong direction for my flight, will avoid this airport again.

To my surprise, the airport was quite clean and kept in well order. The staff were not very nice for some reason, and I strive to always be nice to everyone that works hard like I see these people doing. I did not get my kindness in return. It wasn't too crowded for a Saturday afternoon, and the lines were alright as well

commentHeader: asked multiple employees to help and nobody did
reviewContent: I had a flight today from Newark Airport into Detroit. I got to the airport at 8.45 for a flight that was scheduled to depart at 10.05. I had 3 bags, so I knew I needed to check one of the bags. Most airports let me check a bag at the gate. I have done so at Newark before. The TSA Worker stopped me and asked me to show her my boarding pass before I entered the security line as expected. Than she told me that I had 3 bags and therefore had to go downstairs to check one. I than said that I planned on just checking my bag at the gate. She said "downstairs". And I said "wait can't I check it at the gate". She said I wasn't allowed through until I went downstairs. So I went downstairs. The staff were very unhelpful and the lines were ridiculous. When I finally checked my bag. I went back up to the security line. The same worker as before was trying to tell me I couldn't have 2 bags and had to check the other (which clearly isn't true, your allowed a personal bag and a carry-on bag). They were both small backpacks so its not like they were big. I think she may have been trying to take advantage of the fact that I'm a freshman in college and look like I don't know what I'm doing. I'll give her the benefit of doubt and say maybe it was miscommunication though as she wasn't clear and kept just saying "check bags downstairs" and wouldn't really answer my questions. I then was in the security line. The signs said 15-20 minutes. This was at 9.05, so an hour before my departure time. The line was moving pretty slow, so along the way I asked a couple of workers if they could help me since my flight was pretty soon. They said no, which was understandable considering I still had 30 mins until boarding started, and the lines were only "15-20 minutes". At about 9.25 (boarding starts at 9.40, ends at 9.50), I was still pretty far back in the line and it was clear the line wasn't moving. I then again asked the original TSA worker to help me as she was right next to me at this point. She said "I can't do anything about it. If boarding starts in 10 minutes the gate is already closed." First off that doesn't even make sense. The gate closes after the boarding ends. Anyway I kept on going through the line, and I was pretty close when it was 9.40 (boarding start). However, the line was going very slowly. I got to the point where you put your bags onto the belt at 9.45, 5 minutes before the gate closes. Since there were so many people putting their bags on their, my bags weren't being moved into the moving line. I asked the worker if she could put my bags in quickly since I had a flight to catch. She just stared at me with a blank stare. A kind man and a woman behind me asked me when my flight boards. I explained that the boarding started 5 minutes ago. They both said that it was ridiculous that they had seen me ask multiple employees to help and nobody did. The 2 people in front of me heard the conversation and let me move in front of them to try to make my flight. I got out of security at 9.48 and sprinted to the gate. When I got there at 9.51, there were 0 employees at the gate, and none at the surrounding gates either. I eventually found an employee at a gate 6 away from mine. He was the most helpful employee of the day. He told me to go to customer service and helped me get a new free ticket for a flight 4 hours later. It turns out that the flight left 10 minutes early and they closed boarding early as well. Terrible service. I'd rate them a 0/10 if possible.

commentHeader: subjected to music we do not want to hear
reviewContent: The music is so loud and annoying. I tried to watch a movie with noise cancelling headphones on and could not hear it over the music. It also makes it difficult to hear the announcements. Not everyone likes the same music so I don't know why we have to be subjected to music we do not want to hear. I hate to fly out of here but sometimes I am forced to use this airport and I always dread it. Why does the anyone think it's a good idea to create a more chaotic environment. It seems an easy thing to fix. Lower the volume.

commentHeader: lazy, entitled, abusive, rough and mean
reviewContent: I have never reviewed TSA or any other airport for that matter, but these people are so abusive in their perceived 'power' over the public that it is inconceivable to not give a review. The majority of the TSA staff at Newark are not just rude ... they shouldn't be assisting people in any capacity whatsoever. The initial 'greeter' was a woman that glared and yelled at every one filling up their baskets in the most hostile fashion that people seemed to be cowering. As you moved thru the line she intermittently yelled at older travelers if they moved to slow, or used the wrong kind of basket (although she didn't do anything to replenish the 'correct' ones to her bays) and generally terrorized the guests. It was actually so absurdly over the top that it was humorous at first until you passed thru the scanner and made it to the other side where the remaining 7-10 TSA employees (definitively more TSA employees than in any other airport that I've seen at any one time), loitered and talked amongst themselves and pointedly refused to assist anyone. They would not make eye contact or converse with guests who were trying to catch a flight. If you can avoid Newark airport in general (all Union restaurant and bartenders) ... and of course I had to wait to review because the wifi is so useless...you'll be happier, but that is just the icing on the cake. If you can avoid Newark TSA 'agents' .. lazy, entitled, abusive, rough and mean. I'd say you've dodged a bullet. I feel like someone should report them to their superiors .. but to have hired those people in mass makes me think whomever is in charge wouldn't care to improve.

I'm a frequent traveler and never have been compelled to write a negative review for an airport experience until now. Lack of proper signage to tell you where you should go. Worst of all is the rude TSA staff that feel the need to hurl snarky insults to the taxpaying passengers who pay for their salaries. They live up to the stereotype of Newark, New Jersey being called the most unfriendly city in the world. First time to EWR and probably the last. Avoid Newark if you can!

commentHeader: It is too small to cope
reviewContent: I would avoid Newark Airport as much as possible. It is too small to cope. Even many of the washrooms are only portable chemical sheds. The screening lines are long and the supervisors rude. I waited 45 minutes in one line only to be told to move to another due to my hip implant where a full body scan was required. It would have been helpful to have some signs or instruction. Even the Air Canada business class lounge was terrible. My wife and I need to stand for some time before finding a small desk to share with other disgruntle passengers.

commentHeader: the most ridiculous setup I’ve ever experienced
reviewContent: The worst setup for getting food at an airport. Tried to get a quesadilla at Philley Cheesesteak. No signs or indications where to place your order, pay for your order, or where to sit with your food.
