When asked food service staff they were rude with directing me as if it should be obvious that you pay for your food across the aisle at a separate counter. I placed my order and it took 45 minute to get a quesadilla only after I called the lengthy wait to the staff’s attention. I received a text that my food was ready 1 hour after placing the order. Whoever thought of this concept for food service should be fired. I’ve never written a review for anything before. This experience was so bad. A two hour layover that should have been relaxing was replaced with the rudest food staff I’ve ever encountered and the most ridiculous setup I’ve ever experienced for getting food anywhere.

commentHeader: must be the worst airport in the world
reviewContent: I have traveled to 45 states and 20 countries and this must be the worst airport in the world. Totally inadequate and disorganized, with unfriendly, rude people everywhere. Do not do an international transfer from this airport unless you allow 3 to 4 hours. EWR is over rated with a score of 2 out of 10.

This airport is a joke! One security line for hundreds of people, unfriendly staff, free WiFi doesn’t work, departure screen never updates so had to rein on my cellular data, at a charge to get updated info because WiFi doesn’t work. Portapotties for bathrooms, no employees to ask for help and extremely dirty! Avoid this airport if you can!

I was departing late at night. None of the water fountains in the waiting area were working forcing passengers to buy bottled water at ridiculous prices. There were only 2 food places opened and both with huge lines. The coffee machine didn't work. Not a pleasant experience waiting for your flight.

commentHeader: TSA here really over extend themselves
reviewContent: The TSA here really over extend themselves to make you miss your flight. They wouldn't let go of my mothers insulin at security, almost breaking and ruining her cooler insulin bag and damaging her insulin and making a mess of her two carry ons. They made her stay there for 30 minutes because the staff had never seen a cooler insulin bag like that. Because of TSA ignorance she almost lost her insulin and her flight. Secondly, a United bag drop personnel was making such a big deal about me getting their paper tags that were on top of the counter for passengers to use, saying that I should have asked, so why the heck is it on top of the counter without a sign to ask for it? If we paid for the tickets including luggage we have the right for tags so tags are included and what we paid for. This staff just look like they are miserable and want to pass that on to you at your own time and expense.

commentHeader: will do my best to avoid
reviewContent: Arriving was ridiculous. I understand there were weather problems, but even Americans were required to speak to a border agent. Had US passengers been granted entry with the machines, then waiting wouldn't have been so bad. In the end, filling the card was useless and the machines served essentially to take your picture and to tell you to report to passport control. It took one hour just to leave the airport. Signage was confusing, border agents weren't very friendly and the layout is illogical. I asked the supervisor, apparently everyone speaks to a border agent. Then why are there machines? Leaving, security was a bit slow. I will do my best to avoid this airport in the future.

commentHeader: Coming into immigration was a disaster
reviewContent: United Airlines arrived on time, and we disembarked in a timely fashion. Coming into immigration was a disaster. First we had to wait in a line to scan our passports and fingerprints, and customs form, we had already filled out a hard copy on the plane, and a picture. Then we had to wait in line over an hour, it wasn't particular full, just not enough windows open. Then we got to the immigration officer, a nice guy, he scanned our passports, which we had already done, he took our finger prints which we had already done, he took our picture which we had already done, and looked over our customs declaration hard copy, which we already had filled out on the first machine. No reason at all to have to wait twice in line for the same thing. After collecting our luggage we had to wait in line again for about 20 minutes just to pass thru the customs officer, only 2 officers were there, before we could exit. It took over two hours from leaving the plane till exiting the airport. That is after a 8 hour flight.

This place is terrible, I have traveled through here many times but not for a couple of years, on arrival I had a 3 hour layover but made my connecting flight by 10 minutes due to the lack of staff both at immigration and security for the next flight? The queues were ridiculous, on departure things were no better, 4 hours to spare so decided to gave a meal and a drink, the prices for both are ludicrous, a steak with no accompanying fries or anything was $47 (before we start with the tipping con) a single beer comes in at over $10 and every bar or food outlet has identical pricing ! You have to order through these horrible pads with no cash option (what happened to the states love of the free market here ?) I will endeavour never to use this airport again.c

commentHeader: airport does not have enough wheelchairs
reviewContent: Senior Citizens - Expect the worst at Liberty Newark.. I am a 79 year old man. I was traveling with my wife who is 73 years old. Both of us have mobility issues and therefore we had tickets that allowed us to avail wheelchair facility at the airport. (I was traveling from Mumbai in July.) To my utter disappointment, the airport does not have enough wheelchairs. We were made to wait for a significantly long time to get one, when we needed two. I made it known to the airport official that we will not leave unless my wife also gets one. To this, the official was absolutely rude, rude to the point that he made me stand up from the wheelchair that I had and asked me, in a ruder tone, to wait further. Without an ounce of respect for our age, and consideration of our disabilities or the fact that we have been traveling for more than 16+ hours, he left us to our fate. A young attendant after some time finally came to our rescue with another wheelchair which I was given, while my wife walked slowly behind. If the airport cannot take care of senior citizens, particularly from far off places, then the airport is in no position to boast of service quality. Expect the worst when you travel to or from this airport. Having less facilities is understandable, but a rude behavior from officials should simply not be tolerated. The staff need a lot, a lot of training with customer interaction. This is not my first time traveling to a foreign destination. We have travelled to 12 nations of the world. I never expected that my first experience with a US airport would be the worst. I am booking my return ticket from New York.

This is fairly good airport. It is clean and the ground security are efficient. We had an easy peasy check in and boading time when we were there. There are plenty of food options in the airport and wifi is available.

Everything is wrong about this airport. Why cant they they have areas for smokers? Wouldent affect the non smokers at all so why cant smokers smoke when they want to smoke here? Our plane was delayed, and we had to buy some food. But at what prices? I have never paid so much for so little. 11$ for a Pizza slice! Gate was changed 3 times, and every time we had to pass people coming out from Security check.

I am outraged. Our flight was delayed for an hour, and then we had to wait an hour after we landed to get off a plane. Now we have to wait two hours to get our luggage because they won’t tag the bags out until then.
Plane on time and no gate available, this was Terminal C, United Airlines, more than an hour waiting for a damn gate. Sat on this plane tired and hungry. Unbelievable.

Crazy situation at Newark after arrival from Heathrow. Hundreds of people came in from various flights but initially only 3 operatives were working. Eventually ( and I mean eventually!!)another 3 desks opened. While I understand the need for security , it was very frustrating to take 2 hours to go through immigration after an 8 hour flight when all it would have taken would have been more operatives being employed who could deal with passengers more efficiently and effectively. On the other hand, on return to the airport to Heathrow, security staff were laughing and joking with children and passengers and shouting out which computer games were the best which seemed to me inappropriate for such an important role. I mentioned a stray case which seemed to have been left. The response was less that concerned! Beware Newark!!

Totally disorganised and unhelpful. Airport machines are stupid. 2hours 20mins in transfer and the whole time was spent queuing and stressed. Their unhelpful attitude really does not help, we just made our flight out of Newark

I have never seen a more demoralized, slow, and unmotivated TSA team than the one working at EWR. Not to mention unbelievably rigid. Nowhere outside of Newark airport does the TSA so unapologetically take your belongings. For instance, they threw my Nalgene water bottle in the garbage because it had the tiniest amount of water. Face wash that I was allowed to bring on the plane on the last flight was thrown in the garbage. It’s slow, chaotic and unfriendly. What is management doing to these people that they operate at such a low performance level? From the moment you step in the airport your accosted with terrible customer service. This place contributes to NJ’s poor image throughout the country. As an NJ native, it bugs me that we do so poorly.

On no level did this airport succeed in providing a satisfying or even acceptable experience. Have had far more pleasant and efficient experiences at airports in Africa, Asia, and Latin America in supposed 'third world countries' than at this abomination. I am a native born American fluent in English, yet there was virtually no signage, unjustified delays, no information, my gate and departure time was changed three times, exceptionally inefficient management of space (inadequate space for TSA and always between gates), filthy and overcrowded bathrooms, an obnoxious and distasteful obligatory system for making an order at a restaurant, pathetically high prices, overworked and insufficient quantity of staff (who were also largely uninterested in being helpful), exceptionally poor connections between terminals. Over an hour for the luggage to make it from the plane to the baggage rotisserie. Then a chaotic and poorly designed means to re-deliver baggage for a connecting flight. There were a good number of plugs and outlets to recharge a laptop of phone. That is literally the only redeeming thing I can say about my four hour misery in this airport. Avoid at all costs. This airport is a travesty and an example of how poorly designed, inefficient, and unpleasant so much of America's infrastructure has become.

The staff here is among the rudest people I've ever encountered (except for the lady in customs.) I flew in from Barcelona and everything was fine until we got to security going back in. This one TSA agent gave a nasty attitude to every person in line, making a big deal out of putting items in the bin. In terms of food options and shops, the airport is decent. However, I'm giving the airport a low rating solely because of the staff.

commentHeader: hard to find anything that worked well
reviewContent: We travelled through this airport for the first time, and having been through many of the airports in the world, this one is on the bottom of the list with NAIA Manila, as well as most African airports. It is hard to believe this airport is in a first world country, as the service and facilities (in Terminal A) are pathetic, to say the least. It is hard to find anything that worked well, and in addition, Terminal A food options are severely limited. Will do everything possible to not use this airport again.

Rude TSA at check point 40-50. Spirit is the worst airline I have ever used. Canceled my flight and didn’t tell me where my luggage is or give me guidance on how to reschedule. Parking is confusing. Most of the luggage handlers and gate people I have seen barely speak English. Really bad airport.

commentHeader: It was like an oven in the terminal
reviewContent: Terminal B-1 (gates 40-49) at EWR sucks! I was flying through here to Detroit. The security line was a mess with rude agents and the process took way too long, most of the restaurants in the terminal were closed and the ones that were open were way overpriced, and the terminal had no air conditioning in the middle of July. It was like an oven in the terminal and there was one dingy old fan for ten gates. Also the carpet was dirty and there weren't enough seats. It's like this terminal was made in the 60s for turboprop planes and never redone! Somehow, LaGuardia is significantly better than EWR. Never again.

Worst airport ever. Got in at 11.00pm after a 9 hour flight and had to get another 5 hour flight 5 hours later, so we needed a place to sit and relax. The seating is very limited. Most airports provide rows of seats, however this airport has replaced the normal seating with large tables with limited seating that is somehow meant for ipad surfing at the tables and there seems to be a charge for this. The few row of seats that still exist are divided by metal arm rests which prevent the overnight waiting folks from stretching out, and definitely prevents mothers from holding babies and children, a very family unfriendly airport. It simply does not accomodate families at all. The alarm at the gate door keeps going off. It has been going for over an hour. What good is an alarm if the staff does not come and investigate. Customs requires a checkin at a kiosk. We tried four kiosks, and none if them actually worked. One man was helping people, and he was nice enough, but he couldn't get them to work either. He said the internet connection was slow and they have problems with this all the time. Really? Fix this! We finally managed to get the 5th kiosk to work, but it took us about 20 minutes. Then there was the line for the agent. Then there was the line for the luggage. Then it spit us back out into the unsecured area and we had to go back through TSA. The food look awful and was horribly overpriced. We waited to purchase something on the plane. We weren't about to buy poor quality overpriced food at this airport. Bathrooms were filthy. The tables with the ipads are filthy underneath. The chairs are bolted to the floor so apparently they can't get in there to clean. The way the seating was arranged is not family friendly. Worst experience ever at an airport.

I entered International from the Port of Spain heading on to Washington Dulles. I cleared customs, rechecked my baggage on the green route and tried to take a shuttle to Terminal C. it didn't work. I was told to walk by a customer service agent. So I did, and found that I had to go through an entire security line again! By doing so they took three hot sauces from Trinidad I brought back for family and friends. I did not think at any point I'd be going through security again so I had put it in my carry on after buying it at a shop at the gate in POS. I've never had to reroute to security after landing and having a connecting flight. I nearly missed my next flight too. The airport was dirty, the signage confusing or lacking completely, and the security ridiculous. Never again.

I got off the jetway of an SAS flight from Stockholm to Newark to Phoenix. That was the last good thing that happened at this airport. All the bad things that happened: 1) Passport Control/Customs: Huge line, took nearly an hour to get through, because half the kiosks were closed or broken and half of the agents booths were unmanned. The staff providing directions were unintelligible most of the time. 2) Baggage check: Signs directing me to transfer my bag after customs were confusing. I ended up in a line for United Air when I needed to be in another terminal. 3) Inter-terminal transportation. Train between terminals was down, and nobody could determine if it would be up any time soon. Worker yelled at people that they could walk, with no other info. 4) Signage - sucks. 5. Walk between terminals was long, over broken sidewalk. Because of that (and #3) I nearly missed my checkin. All in all, a great airport to avoid.

Started with check-in. My bag was placed on the belt without my bag tag given to the agent. She initially pulled up the wrong travelers to get us checked in. TSA seemed way understaffed and very slow. Nothing was clear about what lines were what. It was very chaotic. Then nothing was open at 10am to eat except for two small coffee shop type places. Green Bean Coffee customer service was awful. The guy at checkout kept checking his phone. The breakfast sandwiches were cold and smoothies were not available but on the menu.

commentHeader: airport is dirty and poorly kept up
reviewContent: To say that Newark is a "terrible airport" is a compliment. Any words to describe it are not for publishing was they are so awful and profane. The personnel are not a happy and helpful bunch. They're doing you a favor to be there. You feel that you are imposing on them. The airport is dirty and poorly kept up. The USA is the only country that I know of where luggage trollies are rented. Welcome to the USA. This is not what we are all about. Customs is a joke. They're understaffed, unfriendly and belligerent. The redcoats (non customs officials) herd and yell at you like cattle and remind me of what my grandparents told me when speaking of concentration camps. This is Newark International for better or worse. Mostly for worse.
Newark is a terrible airport. From the unfriendliness of all the staff to the small boarding areas with pitiful options for food and beverage at your gate. I will never fly out of here again.

My home airport for over 50 years and only gets worse with age. While they have updated the terminals over the years customer service is poor to non-existent. Recently flew back from Barcelona on Sat. 5/25/19 (holiday weekend) and trying to get through US Customs was not only a nightmare but a national disgrace. At 3pm only two (2) yes that's right 2 were on duty to check through hundreds if not thousand of flyers entering the USA. A near riot nearly broke out due to the people having to wait over 2 hours for no other reason than poor staffing. The agents on duty were slow as sap in January (apparently they deal with this low staffing all the time) and have no sense of urgency in getting folks through customs. I was told this was normal staffing levels. As an American I gotten use to poor service in public transit but it does leave a sour taste with foreigners entering the US for the first.

This airport is always backed up and causing so many delays. They delay flights all the time for the stupidest reasons and the tsa lines are slow the drop off area is always a mess. Worst airport in the country.

Short and sweet here: Travelers apparently rated this the worst airport in America in 2018. That's unfair only to the extent that other airports probably don't deserve to be denigrated by even being included in the same category as Newark Liberty. It's dirty, inconvenient, dated and inefficient, staffed by a lot of incompetent and unfriendly people, and the area around it is bleak even for a generally bleak spot like northern New Jersey. They should just flatten this place and route traffic through other places that care about doing a decent job and know how to do it.

The single worst airport I have ever experienced. Nearly 1000 passengers entered customs at about the same time, and there were only two agents to process them. After an hour of waiting, I traipsed all over Terminal B trying to follow instructions for Baggage Control, another security check, getting to Terminal C, etc. Whoever designed the signage for Newark Liberty should be fired. Roughly three hours later I arrived at my gate to discover that they were already boarding a bus, where 50 people were stuffed shoulder to shoulder for about 20 minutes before boarding the plane. In my hours at the airport, only one employee was either kind or helpful. The others I dealt with were unbelievably rude and unhelpful. I am an older woman, and I hope I have never treated a fellow human being the way I was treated. The bottom line: if you can avoid Newark, do so at all costs. I certainly will.

commentHeader: Security set up is not fit for purpose
reviewContent: Security set up is not fit for purpose. I waited in line for one hour for security checks. There were only three aisles in operation, one for first class/priority for all international flights from terminal 2. And once through security the gates area is horrible. Restroom facilities aren’t big enough for the number of passengers (just four stalls in the men’s, with the lack of privacy and cleanliness typical of bathroom facilities in the US). Oh, and when I arrived here the other day from London I was stood in line for 2.5 hours at immigration. Just a hopeless and depressing way to enter and leave NYC. It makes London Heathrow seem positively heavenly by comparison!

Well, I can say at the least, Newark is an embarrassment. We arrived at terminal A, and had a connecting flight to Frankfurt, Germany. We had to navigate to terminal B, specifically gate B62. I looked up for the signage, directing me to the appropriate terminal. Terminal B was down a level, and by bus, the signs said we would be arriving. We took the elevator, as we had some carry-on luggage and the stairs looked, precarious. I could quite possibly be over-exaggerating, but we waited at this old elevator for what seemed like a solid 5 minutes, before the door opened. It was like a time warp, back to the 80's inside this elevator. We exited and saw a bus. As I approached the airport worker, I asked her if this bus went to terminal B. Very rudely, she asked me which gate. I told her gate B62. She said that this was not my bus, no bus goes to B62, and that I would have to go back up to terminal A, take a right, and another right and then I could get to terminal B. Confused because of the signs I just read, directing us to this bus, we turned around. Not wanting to wait for the slow elevator, we opted for the stairwell. The stairwell leading back to the terminal, was completely atrocious. Bird wire fencing for walls, trash, dirt and cigarette stench enveloped the narrow and steep stairs. I am not sure if they are even OSHA compliant. There was room for only one direction of travel up and down the stairs. A person walking down would have to stop, mash up against the bird wire fencing and wait for them to pass by. So we take a right and then another right, and we see a sign for terminal B and an arrow, but the "B" has been painted over, as if to signify that terminal B was not in the direction we were directed to go! We were basically leaving the airport, by following this rude airport workers' advice. I asked one of the security workers in that hallway if we could get to terminal B this way, and he rambled off on some rude tangent about can't I read the signs? Totally rude and un-helpful. Not wanting to miss our flight by leaving the terminal, we back tracked to the area we began from, in hopes to see another poorly illustrated sign. Luckily a flight attendant was sitting close by, and saw the look of confusion on our faces. She informed us that yes, we were supposed to leave the terminal, take the sky train to terminal B, gate B62. Off we went. When we got off the train, all I could see was a long line of passengers, waiting to get through security. Regrettably, we had to join that line. The line was formed with mis-matching, dated stanchions, crooked and not even wide enough to pull a carry-on through. In the back ground, all I could hear was security officers yelling and belittling passengers for having candy in their bags, over and over again. Publicly shaming these poor foreign passengers, in my country, which I love and have served and protected. I was so embarrassed. Is this how America treats people? First impression is the most important and this was a complete nightmare. Thank goodness my flight to Frankfurt was delayed, because I would not have made it home that day. We got through security and all the passengers at gate B62 were still standing in a long line, waiting to board. The entire airport was dark, dank, out dated and just rude. It was so refreshing to arrive (late) at Frankfurt, where there is order and cleanliness and polite people. Get your crap together, Newark. You are a shameful experience. Never again. Never.

As other reviews state, we should be embarrassed. Upon entering terminal B [International Terminal, where one might think we'd showcase our best side], there is woefully poor signage to direct you to you check-in area. Then, after asking 2 airline associates at 2 different areas, we located the SAS counter. Next Security! 1hour, 40 minutes. Nope, not exaggerating. And to add insult to injury, several other passengers in the line stated this was 'the norm'. Frankly, it took less time to drive to the airport from Pennsylvania! Not acceptable. Then into the departure terminal. Dingy. Tired. Dated. Ok, we'll feel better after a bite and a drink. Alas we had exactly 1 choice. Shameful. Could I be more aggravated? Yes I could. 2 bratwurst, 2 draft beer, tip. Go ahead, guess. Nope. OK: $52.00. Incidentally - this is my 14th flight this year, lest you think this is a random complainer. The saddest part is the view this airport gives to our foreign visitors. Yes, I am deeply embarrassed. I see a new terminal is in planning to replace Terminal A. That and B can not happen fast enough. Shame on us.

Pretty smooth transitions from each security checkpoint. The TSA line was slightly longer but that's usual and it was not that bad. Airport staff were quite nice and the food choices in the Airport are very wide and good.

Horrid. There was no seating option before check in, upper and lower decks have been cleared of virtually all seating, not even anything for the elderly. Also, the only indicator for where our checkin would be, Iceland Air, was a tiny logo on a carry-on bag size check stand. At the gate, the options for dining were frighteningly limited. Outlets for charging are limited and taken up quickly as well. I remember EWR being much more gracious 15 years ago. It is rapidly approaching 3rd world standards, with which I am also acquainted. I will endeavor not to travel through Newark again.

The most despicable way to welcome and greet people to any country if this is how they treat them at immigration. I travelled on an ESTA from the EU with an EU passport. The waiting time was 2.5 hours. There was no apology, no sense of staffing more booths, no facilities for elderly people to take a seat, drink water, use the toilet without losing the position in the lines. We had just come off an 8 hour flight from Heathrow. How on earth does the self proclaimed "greatest country on earth", one of the richest nations on our planet think it can treat people like that is completely beyond me. The staff - true to form - treated the situation as a normal everyday occurrence (which is even more concerning). The eventual mini interview was conducted in the standard cold, non-apologetic way. I'm so underwhelmed and angry about how this major airport represents the wonderful American people I got to know.

commentHeader: rude and completely apathetic bossy staff
reviewContent: I’ve never encountered more rude and completely apathetic bossy staff as at immigration. Everyone had a withering horrible attitude. They can’t look you in the eye, they say “have a nice day” (or nothing) with the worst deadpan tone that purposely conveys how much they hate their job and you. Their faces could sour milk. Welcome to the US indeed. They treat perfectly polite travellers like we are animals. Also the prices for food are astronomical. Hard to believe anyone would actually shell out that much money for junk food

I flew to Newark from the UK. At immigration the hall was completely full - about 500 people I would guess. I waited two hours to be seen. There were 3 members of border staff and at one point 1 went on a break. I missed my connection and had to fly the next day. The red coats who had the badge “here to help”, when I said I was going to miss my connection said” not my problem honey”. Firstly having so many people queuing for so long is a health and safety issue, hardly a welcome to the US. I fly frequently worldwide and have never experienced such treatment and rudeness by staff supposedly there to help. This airport is a disgrace and management should employ more staff and certainly train them in manners. It is customer service at the end of the day. Also,there are other airports in New York and I will use them in the future.

I think it's the worst airport I've ever been, being in the US and moreover serving basically the city of NY. At the arrival I found extremely long queues at the immigration desk for ETSA (I think we have been standing for about 2 hours after a 9 hours flight from Europe arrived at night). I departed from the terminal B and here I found the same story: incredibly long queues at the check-in and at the security and baggage check. (Fortunately I arrived 4 hours in advance) In addition the guys at the security were really bossy. What to say about the kiosks selling food at the terminal? Actually there were only 3 or 4 selling common junk food for an exaggerated price. There's no shopping area at all at that terminal. In other words an old, neglected, unpleasant and inefficient airport that you could never expect to find in the US. Scandalous!! I think I'll never fly again to this airport.

commentHeader: one of the worst airport experiences
reviewContent: Probably one of the worst airport experiences. Immigration lines for ESTA tourists and US citizens lasted approximately 1.5 hours. Then there are two more lines before a passenger is outside the terminal. The AirTrain is old and constantly delayed. It made 6 unplanned stops before reaching the railway station.
Long lines, horrible food, uncomfortable seats, music too heavy, probably the worst airport I have ever seen. For the US, it is ridiculous.

Terminal C check-in was chaotic on the morning of March 18. Several kiosks were down and lines were long. The TSA pre line was blocks long, and passengers could not locate the end of the line. Line jumping was common. United staff response: "I have no idea." United needs to remedy this chaos. Until then, I will avoid Flying United out of Newark Liberty.

Maybe, if we focused on fixing our infrastructure instead of wasting money on walls, we would not have a NY airport that is routinely described as a dump. Are we really content to be a third world country? Whoever is running this place should be ashamed. No soap. No paper towels. No air conditioning until April 15 even though every patron is covered in sweat. Really? Pathetic. I will never again schedule a flight through this hellhole.

Down right rude employees. I would be fired on the spot if I treated customers the way this airport does. There was a very pleasant lady at baggage check but past that, especially security, there is no small talk, no “Hi” or “have a nice day” at one point I heard one of the employees tell at person “yeah, you or I don’t actually care who steps up but someone needs to now!” I’m appalled.

Every person that works in this airport has an attitude, don't even try to ask anyone for directions. No one wants to be there and are just downright rude. I will avoid this place in the future. From desk attendants to car rental these people do not deserve jobs! Being stranded in this huge hole is scary and there is no compassion at all! Was not even treated like a human being.

Do not transfer through this airport! For me to get from one terminal to another I had to first take a bus to another terminal, then exit that terminal and then take the airtrain to the terminal and then go back through security! I have traveled for many many years, 2 to 3 times a month, and this is the worst, most poorly laid out airport I have ever gone through. (This includes 3rd world airports I have traveled through!) Charles de Gaulle is now 2nd place in the worst airport to transfer thanks to Newark. Avoid this dump. Plus the food choices are few and far between. Go to Atlanta for any transfers. Best US large airport for transfers.

First, I encountered the rudest TSA agent who treated everyone with disrespect. She even yelled at an elderly woman being assisted in a wheelchair. That is when I asked a TSA agent to report her. Stuck in Terminal A, there were consistently long lines of 15 or so to the women’s washroom. We had it good as the men’s was totally disabled and they had to use the “permanent” porta potties. 3rd world airport, 1st world prices, most disrespectful TSA (do they know who pays their salaries?).

There is a reason this airport ranks so low on all reviews-and apparently the management/owners couldn’t care less! It is so bad it is like you are proud of the bad service, long lines, filthy bathrooms in the hallway-like port-potties, rude wait staff, rubbish coffee, horrible, overpriced. Do you work at making the experience a misery? Gut the place and start over-admit your epic fail and try harder next time, try like you care.

Terminal C Seems airport made anagreement for the same operator run the majority of the non-fastfood restaurants. They all have ipads everywhere. Seems the kiosks are run by the same company. What a lack a vision by management. Take a look at Copenhagen which I know well. All restaurant are franchises of popular restaurants in the city, there is an H&M and all the usual luxury shops. You actually want to eat and shop there. In EWR nothing appeals to me. Not enough seats as they have all been replaced with bigger ipad desks.

Customs clearance took over an hour. Not many desks open and people cutting line. Suitcase found thrown off the belt in baggage hall. Faceless check-in where we were unable to change our seats to sit together at the front desk. Not everyone is computer savvy or has the time to check in on line and not everyone carries a credit card. Ordering a drink by the app took over an hour to receive as we did not know where our order went. Eventually did get some help and our drinks by asking someone. Did not enjoy the experience of going through Newark airport.

Almost everyone in the airport has a terrible attitude and customer service is very bad, the ladies who push the the disabled passengers were pushing us to get in front of us in the elevator. The airport is very dirty, airports in third world countries are cleaner than this airport. No couches or even carpeted area to lay down incase your flight was delayed, my flight was delayed 7 hours and my rear end became like a piece of brick from sitting down. Again almost everyone in this airport was very rude!

Very bad customer service. The agents are disrespectful and don’t try to understand the problems of the travelers. I got treated as a less than nothing and they canceled my ticket for no reason. I stayed at the airport without a solution for 9 hours. I hate this airport and I don't recommend.

commentHeader: the worst airport in the US"
reviewContent: So whose the genius who thought that 4 urinals and three commodes in the men’s bathroom was enough for 8000 people roaming Terminal C! This is the only men’s room at any airport where there’s a line. What a joke! Add that to the “friendly” TSA people whose faces would crack if they ever smiled plus the basic look of all the Terminals and you have the worst airport in the US!

Terrible security process. Directed to wrong line, then had to wait 1 hour in line and another 30 minutes waiting for baggage to go through security. Got a bottle from duty free in the Dominican and this airport said it wouldn't fit on their machine and I had to check it or toss it since I didn't have enough time as flight was boarding. Terrible customer service and awful process.

This is the worst airport security process ever. So bad that I am currently in the security line and taking my time to write this. There’s a very long line and only one person checking IDs while 2 others stood and watched. Imagine over 50 people in a line going to one person. Now I have a 5 am flight and been dealing with this line since 3:15 am. It is now 3:53am and I haven’t gone through security yet! There’s no urgency here, 10-15 people at security standing around. Like get it together! It’s going into 2019, there’s no reason it should still take this long especially at this time of day. Hire more people! Make people want to use your airport. Then the staff looks at us with blank stares when we ask them to open more lines or do something so people don’t miss their flights. This airport is a -5 star!

Absolutely terrible airport for transfer. I was traveling with a baby. After 14 hours on the flight from China, I was waiting for a domestic connection. The waiting areas provide very uncomfortable chairs. The announcements about no smoking and safety were blaring super loud from the speakers every 15 min. Neither the baby nor I could have a nap or rest between flights. The bathrooms are outdated and not that clean (such a shame in comparison with bathrooms in Asia). Few times airport and airlines employees took breaks in the gate areas. They had loud conversations and their radios were loud. Shouldn't they be working instead of disturbing travelers? Doesn't the airport provide break rooms? Or were the emoyees hiding from their duties?

The new security procedure is flawed. The person at the front of the line is blocked by bags slowly going into the screening process. So everyone wants to stand at the end and get going. The TSA agents are also rude and don’t help the process. All they do is bark at people. I only fly when absolutely necessary and hope the poor service makes everyone do the same. Poor service should not be rewarded, if a few loose the job because of low ticket sales. I’ll throw a party.

Genuinely cannot begin to explain how awful our experience at this airport was. The staff were rude beyond belief. I have never been treated or spoken to so badly, the lady who was re-booking us due to a flight cancellation at the BA desk in terminal B did not want to be there and was extremely unpleasant, unprofessional, and giving incorrect information. BA flight 188 to London Heathrow was cancelled due to technical issues and after waiting in line for 3 hours, this kind of experience just makes it worse. After standing in line for hours at 2 am on thanksgiving day she looked at our passports and tells us GO BACK HOME and come tomorrow. I have never encountered such rude, nasty behavior and genuinely do not want to fly to this airport again.

The airport has the worst security facilities, there were more than 100 people waiting in the line and only 1 counter was functional. Some people missed their flights because they could not get through the security in time. When they requested TSA officials about their flight timings, they behaved very rudely and didn't expedite their checking. I have traveled in and out of Atlanta's airport 10s of time never faced this issue. In fact, this problem was observed only in Newark Airport.

Our departure trip was not terrible, which is about as good as it gets with Newark. We were in terminal C, which is the best of the three. Parking is outrageously expensive. We had TSA pre-check, so the line wasn't too bad through security. All of the restaurants are the same, with the tablets sitting in the middle of the table, so it's pretty hard to have a conversation and share a meal with your travel companions, but still much better than the choices at terminals A and B. The return trip shows how poorly this airport is run. Landing late at night, our baggage came suprisingly quickly, but then we needed to take the tram to get to our car. They only run one train at night between the terminals, and then they force you to get off and get on a different train to get to the parking lots. The first train took much longer and was very crowded. It was worse for the second train. We waited a good 10 minutes as the crowd grew, and very nearly did not get onto the hot crowded car. The pre-pay facility at the parking ramp was in poor repair. It took a long time to figure out where to touch the screen to get the buttons to work, (down about an inch from the buttons themselvs!). There were only two lanes open to exit the ramp, and one of them was blocked by another car who couldn't get the automatic ticket to open the gate. Overall, it took almost an hour from landing to getting out of the airport in my car. This place is a mess, is poorly run, and is unfortunately about the only option we have.

Worst airport I have used in many years. Getting there torturous, chaotic at Penn station and then big queues for airtrain. Huge queues at security, very hot, rude staff and extremely poor airside facilities. Extortionate prices for food and drinks and hardly any choice. Awful - avoid if you can.

Genuinely cannot begin to explain how awful our experience at this airport was. The staff were rude beyond belief and if it were warranted I wouldn’t bother posting a review but it absolutely was not. The girl who was checking us in at the BA desk in terminal B did not want to be there and made no effort to connect with us, grabbed my bag from me as if I were an inconvenience to her, and as a nervous traveller these kind of experiences just make it worse. She was asked by an employee if she was being nice and her response with an eye roll was ‘trying to be’. I encountered very few polite people in this establishment and genuinely do not want to fly to this airport again. Toilets were absolutely disgusting, any time you ask for assistance with anything you are treated with a sigh.

I’ve never had any problems at Newark Airport. Pretty swift, but know you’ll be waiting in some lines. I went to check a bag that came to be one pound over the limit. The kiosk told me it would be $225. We were rushing, so I paid it. In shock that I just paid that and didn’t even ask questions, we looked around where to go next. A woman working there came up to me and asked if I wanted her to put on my bag ticket. She noticed it said heavy and asked how heavy it was. The staff member immediately took me through lines to get a refund. It was so kind of her to do that for me - it absolutely made my day and started out my vacation on such a more pleasant note. I am extremely grateful for her! Thank you!

We traveled through Newark twice in Sept. 2018. Unfortunately, I have to report that this is the worst airport experience in years, and we are world travelers. The worst part of the experience was the awful, terrible, confusing and misleading signage. I would really suggest they hire a consultant to review and drastically improve the signage. There were no maps that I could find in the airport, and I had to ask multiple people, often other travelers, to try to find our way around. The worst was trying to locate the SkyTrain. The small signs appear to have an arrow at the end of them, so we followed those, and ended up nowhere. After asking, we were directed upstairs. Then, I think on the 3rd level, there are conflicting signs, one with an arrow down and another, on the 2nd level, with an arrow up! Again we had to ask where to find it. When we finally got to the station, there was a nice official man, who helped make sure we got oriented to the right train. Even on the way back, we had to ask directions again, because we again got confused by the conflicting directions. All of this could have been avoided with clear maps and well-designed signage. On our return from an international flight, we had the misfortune of having to go through customs and security there. It was ridiculously redundant, I think we had to complete 5 lines before getting out, and it was so slow we almost missed our connection. After completing immigration, we had a very slow and inefficient security clearance before getting on our next flight. It seems more personnel are needed, or else streamlining the process.

I can echo most of the previous review word for word" "Awful. Terminal C very loud and not enough seating. Have to listen to irritating music the whole wait. The music is awful. It's like sitting amongst a bunch of bars. I have found this extremely stressful. It's 7:30 am, so most people have been awake for a few hours already. Desperately looking for a quiet place to sit, but the beer garden (completely empty) that takes up a huge section of Terminal C is blasting thumping music. Go somewhere else, it's TVs. The food that is available is overpriced junk food. What an extremely unpleasant place.

Awful. Terminal C very loud and not enough seating. Have to listen to irritating music the whole wait. There was trash in the few available (non table chairs). I had to remove old food containers to find a place to sit. The music is awful. It's like sitting amongst a bunch of bars. I have found this extremely stressful.

My arrival at Newark was my first experience of the USA in the Trump era. I don't know if The Donald is to blame, but it wasn't good. 400 or so people on the plane. Probably 300 of them, including me, foreign passport holders who were directed to one open processing point, while our US friends sailed through their multiple open gates. After an hour in the queue another international plane arrived, probably from China. At this point someone decided to let the international queue go through the US processing gates. If this is what America First means it also may mean less visitors and less of our money. At least the delay meant my bag was waiting for me. Transport from the Airport was good on the train.

commentHeader: the lines are beyond a joke"
reviewContent: I am one of these people who never conplains, usually just get on and deal but this trip tipped me over the edge, cannot deal with Newark airport. It is disgusting, the bathrooms always have huge lines and are gross as is the concourse. My husband and I are TSA approved, the lines are beyond a joke. The TSA agents are rude to put it mildly. I am 51, had a hip replacement 18 months ago, not the average age for this surgery however I get spoken to and treated like I am a moron especially when I line up at the revolving body scanner. It took 20 mins to get through on Sat 8/17/18. Is this seriously the best an airport with mass footfall can do? These people are jobs worth, have no patience and are condescending. Came from Tampa this morning, the experience was so different. Airport is spotless, TSA agents are polite and for the first time ever whilst lining up to go through the body scanner I was asked in a friendly manner if I had metal in my body, it took no time at all to get through. Doubt this review will change anything as no one at Newark seems to care!

After a 4+ hour delay our flight to London was cancelled due to a ‘20 minute’ storm. However it seems that this a common occurrence in this part of the world, at this airport that they are ill prepared for. Terrible communication and service at all levels (bar one woman who helped rebook our flights) which by the way was 2 days later! Seating areas are uncomfortable and sparse. Tired, dirty concourse, hot food left out for hours in the open and very expensive with limited choices. As for baggage reclaim - a total nightmare! I would not recommend this airport to any traveler coming in or out of New York at any time of the year.

Newark airport has always been a hot mess. My specific complaint is the terminal letters and locations. My husband and I arrived to Newark on Thursday July 19, 2018 all was good. On Friday July 20th my 3 kids were coming in. They called us to let us know that they arrived and would be in baggage claim. Coming into the airport we saw terminals A, B and C. They were in C. To get to them with your upper and lower roads was the most craziest thing I have experienced. We kept missing how to get to terminal C going slow and reading the signs. Then trying to get back into the airport it put us out of the way no wehre close to where we were. After 45 minutes circling the airport and almost getting stuck in the parking garage we got to them. Coming back home we flew out of Philadelphia. A piece of cake! Tell your road people to get two civilians to get in a car, read the signs and see if they can get to their people to pick up in baggage claim.

Filthy restrooms, poor food options with quality below expectations. Messy corridors. Staircases without help for elderly people. Worst airport experience so far. Clocks out of order showing wrong time.

commentHeader: does a horrible job at hiring staff
reviewContent: This is not the first time I have had a bad experience with TSA. This is the second time in a row and it will happen again next year I just know it. I don’t know what kind of people you are hiring but Newark does a horrible job at hiring staff. The bathrooms are gross and the toilet seats always have something on them. Food is overpriced for whatever reason. Newark is just money hungry but is bad quality.

Wendy’s always closes early. There is no one to complain to because the manager says we have run out of food, but that is clearly not the case because when I asked for a drink or frosty they said machines have already been cleaned or register is already close. They just simply start closing early regardless the situation. Tonight it was 9.43 and ropes were already barricading the entrance. Terrible attitude by employees.

One of the worst airports I have transited through. In the past, travelled through here en route to Florida. It seemed ok at the time although just before I boarded my connection I realised my wallet had been stolen. The security staff I contacted, and lost and found personnel were extremely unhelpful. It left a bad impression. I was reluctant to book a flight passing through Newark again, but it has been several years so I thought it may have improved - it is worse. This time around, the customer service aspect has not improved one bit. The airport has three terminals. If you are arriving from outside the US (even if you're not staying), you'll need to clear customs and go through security etc. all again. Also be aware that because there is no "within airport" transit area, you need appropriate ESTA to clear customs. There is extremely poor signage for transit passengers. To go between terminals, you hop on the AirTrain which only takes a few minutes. I had plenty of time to kill so explored each of the terminals (pre-security). I would suggest getting your food and drink (if you have time) before checking through security. At terminal A, there is very little beyond the security check point. There are few toilets too, and the terminal is very crowded. So if you can put off checking through to this terminal till you absolutely need to, I would. Terminal C is a lot bigger, and more choices for seating, food and drink but it is also a lot more expensive, even the fast food joints. The cheapest burger place charges about $8 for a burger, another 4-5 bucks for fries, and there was one poor soul making the food for everyone so long waits. I overheard a customer saying "sorry, I know you're busy, but I've been waiting 45 minutes for a chocolate milkshake". Both Terminal A and C security check staff were rude, and would not answer people's questions. At terminal C in particular, there are confusing TSA lines ups. Nobody knows where to go, there is no signage. None of the staff will answer a question, just point you towards another area or queue. There is really nowhere to get food/drink at terminal C until you pass security other than a dunkin donuts. If you have time to spare, go along to Terminal B or A, there are a few other choices like Manchu Wok, Subway, Wendy's etc. Given the airport is so busy, there seem to be routine flight delays. Both my flights out of Newark were delayed. If you have a tight schedule, factor in a couple hours just in case. Also pay attention to your gate. The gate for my return flight changed three times within an hour and there was no announcement in the lounge. It just happened that people were looking at their airline App which updated them. If you have a choice, I would not fly through Newark if I could transit through somewhere else. It's a shame as I like flying with the main carrier using Newark (can't name in this post) but the aggro of going through this place again puts me off entirely.

commentHeader: practically flung my passport at me
reviewContent: I’ve landed and departed at Newark a few times in the past eight years and although I don’t like it, this time there was over a half hour delay to get a gate for disembarking, but then arriving at the queue at Passport Control was unbelievable. I counted over 30 desks and only SIX were manned. The wait to get checked was over an hour, and finally when I did manage to get seen, the arrogant Inspector, chewing gum and looking over my shoulder, told me he couldn’t get my fingerprints. When I asked him why, he still didn’t look my way, but told me to try again and press harder on the screen. When this appeared to also fail I asked him what I was supposed to do. He asked if I was wearing hand cream, to which I replied no. When further pressed, he suggested my hands were “too dry”. What utter nonsense. All the latest fancy technology and it required wet or sweaty hands to get fingerprints taken. I told him I had no problems before, to which he just glared at me. I asked if he had any wipes, so I could clean the screen - which seemed to irritate him more. Finally, I took out my own wipes (luckily I had some, or I would have licked each finger - most unhygienic!). I dampened each finger with the wipes, placed them on the screen and bingo! He practically flung my passport at me. I’m 79 yrs of age, travelling alone, and usually am quite tolerant, but Newark airport has the most rude, arrogant, unhelpful staff and since there was no good reason for holding me up, and worrying my waiting family, I will happily never fly into there again.

Worst airport ever! Where do I even begin, the food is extremely overpriced and gross, although the restaurants look nice they are deceiving. Every single table has an ipad attached to it and when I say every, I mean every. Everyone is on screens, but there is zero wifi which makes no sense. The staff couldn't care less about helping, is understaffed, and is rude. The customer service line was the longest I've ever seen. The staff doesn't pick up food so there is other peoples old food on the table, no thanks. I would avoid this at all cost and go through JFK.
Absolutely the worst in the country. Dirty restrooms, unfriendly TSA and airport personnel, always late due to air traffic control, always problems with airtrain system.

Needs to invest in an urban designer, outside the airport luggage lines block entire sidewalk forcing people into traffic to enter airport. Security lines are set it up so you have to prep for screening one at a time, and there are no family lines. Zero common sense. Workers are indifferent, our daughter was car sick in the line and the guard would not help us with a garbage can. There are no garbage cans in the long line.

Absolutely horrible. I travel all the time and this was worst airport I have ever seen. Rude rude TSA and others. Can't even tell where the queue was for customs - mob scene. I feel so sorry for non Americans arriving here. In the future can travel through Dublin or Shannon and go thru customs there and not have to do it in Newark.

I traveled through this airport going to Spain. I agree with most of these reviews I have read on this site. I experienced long lines because of unprepared TSA officers, not adequately staffed and listened to their bickering between themselves. The TSA officers were rude and seemed not able to exhibit even the smallest of cordial interaction. As we went through customs some of the police officers also exhibited similar behavior. I understand the need for the security checks but there needs to be some component of decency and civility in the process. I intend on never utilizing this airport again and am embarrassed for foreigners visiting the United States and thinking this is how Americans act. It is clear that the TSA and some of the police officers have no checks on their behavior. A simple lesson of manners would serve them well.

commentHeader: longest I have ever had to wait
reviewContent: On arrival, we waited in a 1.5 hour queue for passport control - the longest I have ever had to wait. The airport seems to be operating way over capacity as there were under 10 staff checking passports for hundreds if not thousands of passengers. On departure, the security screening areas also seem far too small and you are forced to stand and wait for at least half an hour. The only positive aspect I experienced was the quality of the food in the departure lounge, however it was extremely expensive.

Worst airport I have experienced. Limited seating even when arrived 2 hours early. Rude employees. Couldn't even sit at open tables around restaurant that for some reason they were roped off. Never again!

commentHeader: Worst airport I have ever been to
reviewContent: Worst airport I have ever been to in my life, staff are unbelievably rude, also lost my luggage a week ago and still have not received it. I have been constantly contacting the airport and have gotten absolutely nowhere. No one seems to want to help and now I am stuck in the UK with no luggage I will never ever go back to the airport or travel with Spirit again.

Horrible experience! Avoid at all costs! Immigration was beyond a nightmare as it was poorly staffed for the number of passengers needed to get through. Dozens of families lost their connecting flights. Have read previous reviews that also stated inadequacies yet management does nothing to improve. Why? Is upper management too lackadaisical? Send your people to Disney to learn how to move volumes of people. In retrospect I will forever avoid this poorly functioning airport. Shame on management. You all need leadership training also. It is a noted fact that all successful corporate cultures start at the top. It was disgraceful that today on June 9 2018 you had so few people on hand to work.

A living dystopia. Noisy and chaotic. Screens everywhere rather than servers, non-stop barrage of ads and news, store selling meancing Trump cutouts and ironic "Keep America Great" sweatshirts, copious alcohol flowing at every turn, presumably to stop people from killing themelves during their connecting flights. People who work in the shops seem pleasant, but general feeling of dread while walking this hellish labyrinth unavoidable except for truly soulless.

I've attached a picture which summarizes the work ethic at this airport. Its a picture of the security people in charge of checking and verifying baggage ownership, they are supposed to ask to see your claim ticket before you leave the terminal with the bag, but these security members played with their phones, oblivious to people around them, like me taking pictures of them. Its a shame, no responsibility, no supervision, no work ethic. This is why Newark Airport is such a mess.

commentHeader: the worst airport in every way
reviewContent: I have travelled through this airport many times. It is the worst airport in every way. It is always loud, overcrowded with very limited service. There is nothing pleasing about the environment. There is limited charging locations. The PA system is always hard to hear. Acoustics are terrible. The facilities are not clean. It seems that all flights are late leaving Newark.

Travelled from Glasgow to Newark with my wife on a city break to NY on arrival and reaching immigration we were faced with very lengthy queue which I can accept however the nature the passengers were processed with was quite an eye opener and disappointing that staff can speak to people with a complete lack of respect. I don't accept that the jobs these people do gives them the autonomy to sit and chew gum and roll there eyes at you is if you are thick. On arriving at Newark for departure home it was more of the same, the staff I believe were having competitions to see who could be the least helpful, I have travelled many destinations and airports but this was on another level for complete lack of customer care which had really taken me by surprise. Overall an unpleasant experience which spoilt an excellent trip to NY.

By far the worst airport I have ever experienced. My sister and I had a connecting flight to Montreal. We almost missed the flight despite arriving an hour and thirty minutes before. We did not stop for food, just five minutes each in the bathroom. We made our flight by the grace of God and the kind people ahead of us in line, allowed us to past them. The TSA agents were so rude, it was actually like a game of let’s see who can be the rudest. They were unhelpful, unorganized and extremely unpleasant. This airport is so confusing. I mean no one knows what they’re doing or how to get to their gates and that is because nobody wants to do their job. Please avoid this airport at all costs. If you have to fly in, be prepared to possibly miss your flight. The other reviews are 100% accurate.

This was the absolute worst experience I have ever had. Truly embarrassing as a major American airport. Complete mayhem, the rudest people I have ever encountered - zero care that you make the flight you have paid for and arrived on-time. Disaster.

I’ve flown at least 50 times. Hands down worst experience of my life. I renewed my drivers license before I left for Florida. Had zero issues there. Zero issues till return trip through Newark NJ. They held me up at front counter tsa for 30 min plus. Then made me do public pat down and ripped through my luggage which took another 30 min. Almost missed my flight...because I renewed my driver lic. In last 7 days! It had not expired. And I had additional documents proving who I am. Stay away at all costs!!! You’ve been warned

Me and my husband we're going on an outbound flight heading for Copenhagen, but sadly, we had to experience Newark airport first. This was by far the worst experience either one of us had of an airport. Both being in our 30s, we have travelled a fair share and seen different kind of airports in different countries, but this was shocking! Our carrier (SAS) informed us to be at Newark airport approx. 1,5-2 hours before departure. But since the weather was a bit off in N.Y.C, we decided to go out to the airport almost 3 hours before departure at 11.30 pm in the evening. As luck would have it! The airport is extremely disorganized, with few signs pointing you in the right direction and not even informative calling in the loudspeakers. Instead, airport staff were going around yelling and shouting seemingly important info, such as that some passengers had to go ahead in line or were missing. Absolutely shocking. The security process itself was also a joke, and very, very time consuming. We stood in line for our security check 1 hour and 45 minutes. The procedure was very shattered and whimsical, and the staff was borderlining on being rude, screaming in peoples faces to remove their shoes. Why not put up a bunch of signs in different languages that explains the security process instead, so people can read and understand while standing in line? That would save both time and frustration. Not all security checks are the same either. All in all, being spoiled by the efficent security and customs in Copenhagen and Amsterdam, it was a nightmare going through Newark airport. There's certainly room for some massive improvements, and hopefully, improvements and effiency are on the top of the list of what to do next at Newark airport. The best advice we can give you, is to be at the airport with very wide time margins. It takes longer than you think (almost forever) and it's not an uncomplicated system. At least for departures, in this regard.

Worst airport in the world. We have been traveling for the past 3 months have been through 10 different airports and Newark is the worst. Badly made gates and terminals. Have to go through multiple security checks because of the stupid gates. Next time I see a flight transiting in Newark I will chose another flight.

I had a connecting flight in Newark on my way to Japan, and I thought it was alright. The staff were okay and decently nice. After check-in, I was amazed at all of the shops and food options and had a great time waiting for my next flight. When I came home from Japan though, it was a completely different experience. The staff were incredibly rude and obnoxious. I was a little confused where I was going and asked an employee for help, she was annoyed that I was confused and yelled directions at me. The other employees were just as rude and the overall atmosphere was unpleasant. Employees wouldn't look people in the eyes, they were on their phones, and leaning on walls/objects lazily. The staff at TSA were horrible, screaming directions at people and were just rude in general. I never experienced such rudeness from TSA/other staff at any other airport I've been to. If you have an option to go/connect to another airport, please do! Also, the WIFI was really bad and I had a hard time connecting to it on 2 different phones.

commentHeader: they are no longer serving food
reviewContent: I am used to UK airports standard, with plenty of choices to eat, and mall-style shopping. However, when you are at a Newark Airport restaurant early evening with 2 hours to spare and told that at 8.30pm they are no longer serving food, and that the only other restaurant in the airport serves food in plastic plates (at $15 for a burger and kettle crisps), you will be let down, no matter what your standards are. I was travelling from Newark terminal B. The queue for security was also appalling, the staff came across as disorganised and did not direct passengers properly so there was a long delay. To add to the bad experience, taxis to Newark from Manhattan do not have a fixed fee so if you are stuck in traffic for 1 hour you could end up paying easily double the usual fare, I would recommend the train to and from Penn Station to Newark airport if you are travelling light, guaranteed price and more reliable than getting stuck in the Holland tunnel during rush hour in a taxi. America, you need to sort out your airports and keep your restaurants open until the last flights of the day and start adding shops, you have a captive audience there, so it's no brainer! Also start adding signs for directions, i.e. signs for departure. I will fly from JFK next time hoping it is better!

commentHeader: worst airport I have been in
reviewContent: Absolutely the worst airport I have been in! No way finding signage to identify where you need to go, incredibly rude staff, slowest screening line I’ve ever seen, filthy bathroom that had a line around the corner.  I will go out of my way to never fly in or out of this airport

The gates at this airport need to be renovated, there was trash and it was dirty. The seats at the gates were falling apart and were very old. The seats did not have chargers for your phone, if you wanted to charge your phone you would have to walk to white tables near restaurants that had chargers. So if you wanted to charge your phone you could not do it at the gate were your plane would take off. I spent a long time looking for a map/directory that displayed restaurants and shops, and I never found it. I visited places to eat and found that the prices are ridiculous for what you are getting. The Wifi Connectivity was really poor, it would suddenly cut on and off at times. The ratio of passengers to staff is awful. It took me 30 minutes to get halfway through the travel assistance line. There was only 2 airline staff for so many people that needed assistance, which made the lines so slow. They need to hire more staff.

commentHeader: one of the worst airport experiences
reviewContent: I could also copy word for word the previous review. I had a six hour layover and it was one of the worst airport experiences of my life. My first thought was the general filth of the place. Staff were rude and unhelpful. The queues were massive and poorly laid out so that they blocked other traffic. Amenities are very limited beyond security. I had a gate change that was not announced. While I was in the toilet two airport workers came in bantering with each other with 'threats' and foul language which I at first thought was intended for me. The chairs were terribly uncomfortable making any rest impossible. In the future I will pay extra for tickets to avoid Newark.

This is one of the worst airports I’ve ever used and I fly most weeks with my job. Poor layout, massive queues, rude/arrogant staff. Having flown for many hours and needing a quick turn around to next flight we found the staff to be unhelpful, uncaring, unprofessional and rude. Based on the other comments on here it seems no one cares that everyone seems extremely unhappy with their service. Terrible airport!

Horrible ground service. Luggage came out 45 minutes after we landed. Then there was only 2 officers for the customs. I missed my connecting flight because of that. Then I had to go through security again even it was just a connecting flight. The lines were crazy. I took me more than 90 minutes to pass the security. Employees are rude and not helpful at all. It was a nightmare at this airport.

The self service food market and restaurants with iPad service are just horrible. Difficult to find a coffee shop. The photos on the ipad menus are not at all like the real food served. All digital instead of people facing service. Reallly inhuman. Lots of horrible clashing music. The worst place in earth to eat or wait. Shame on you UDA.

One of the worst airports in the world. Internet access is very bad, requires stupid Boingo hot spot. It can take a good ten minutes to actually connect if you can figure it out in the first place. No departure board for all airlines you have to find the board for the airline you are using.

I am a very frequent traveler and normally a patient soul. However it continuously stikes me how bad Newark Airport is at handling security and basic customer service. The lines are up to an hour long and while some of the staff is trying to keep the mood up the term customer service is not something most staff has encountered. Traveling from Terminal A it is the same whether in priority line or not. Go on a study tour abroad and see how others handle it. Get some logistic experts to help you out. You are loosing money and customers, myself included.

commentHeader: facilities leave much to be desired
reviewContent: It is clear by the horrendous reviews that no one at EWR cares about what passengers say. No surprise. Get rid of Ruby Tuesdays, and find someone to run a restaurant with somewhast decent service and food. This is not high brow. I typically wait 25 minutes before anyone even shows up to take my order. Terminal A. "A" Third World terminal. (And, I have been to many 3rd world airports. While facilities leave much to be desired, at least service to well-paying customers makes it worth it. Not EWR.

commentHeader: no standard of professionalism or kindness"
reviewContent: Newark and the TSA agents that work there in particular are an absolute joke and a national nightmare. Do everything in your power to avoid this airport. I just stood through an hour and thirty minute wait on a security "training day" (which is somehow happening every single time that I fly through this airport, I have never gotten through security in less than 30 minutes in 3 visits). Many of the passengers on our flight had finally reached the front of the line and were now having our names called out on the intercom. Clearly frustrated by now being on track to miss our flight after arriving hours before our flight, we began pleading with TSA to please hurry up the process as we were going to miss our flights despite being at the airport hours in advance. The TSA woman who was clearly in charge got into a verbal argument with another passenger (not joking), while displaying tremendous attitude, disrespect, and a fundamental lack of empathy. She then ordered a shift change to make a point or spite us or something, further delaying us 10 minutes. There is no standard of professionalism or kindness. Avoid like the plague. Worst airport in the United States.

To be honest, this must be a national embarrassment for the US? Horrendous design, tired and outdated, with dirty restrooms and an appalling restaurant at gate B54. Disappointed not to be told that the 'best' food options were landside, and I did not know that we would not be able to visit any outlets at any other B gate areas once through security. Security queue was slow. I was told iPads did not have to come out of bags (not the same in other global airports). Then I saw a bag being pulled aside from the X-Ray because there was an iPad inside it! TSA agent shouting at a passenger whose tray was being searched, because he was trying to help organise things in the tray to make them easier to inspect. The passenger was forcibly told to get back, then the TSA agent flicked his hands at the man. There's a real problem here with people having some bizarre personal space issues, like every person is out to get them (note - we normal passengers are not out to get you). Food at gate B54 was there worst I have ever seen, anywhere, ever. $14 for 5 dried out chicken nuggets and $9.99 for a beer. The Unusual Times 'restaurant' should be ashamed to even open. Apparently I was the first person today to complain. If it is, people here are far too polite and should rebel at such awful food! Last of all, toilet floors dirty, one sink blocked off, the other one not even stuck down to the shelf, when I pushed the faucet to turn on the water, the whole sink moved. First time into EWR, hopefully my last.

Flew into terminal A from Miami. It was completely hectic. TSA agents were so rude and not helpful at all. When flying back on my return trip I was asking which baggage claim area to go to and all I was told was to go downstairs. Most TSA agents and customer service representative would not help me at all, if it wasn’t for some young man working on the escalators I would have never found my baggage. Thank goodness that young man took the time to actually walk me over to the correct carousel. There actually are some nice people left in this world.

Airline staff are great but airport workers do not care one little bit about their jobs or customers. Bathroom I visited near gate C130 was dirty and the girl working there was busy with her hair. I bought food and coffee which was good but again, poor customer service and a general lethargic attitude. They don’t even have to cash you out, customers do that at kiosks. I will avoid when I can.

I arrived at this airport for the first time from international flight originating from Bangkok to Tokyo. This is approximately 20 hours of economy class comfort and Newark was my connection to RDU (Raleigh-Durham). It was also my third security gate passage in that 20 hour span and I had been mostly without sleep for the last 24 hours upon arrival at Newark. Overall, I found the security gate staff at Newark to be among the rudest and worst-behaved non-professionals in my limited flying experience as a passenger. They bark orders like you're in boot camp, and do not allow passengers ample organization time to move through the gate. I was carrying laptop computer and other carry-on bag, and did not wish to separate too far from them while moving through the gate. I was tired, slightly confused and forgot to place my smartphone in my personal items bin. They made a big deal about my forgetting to do this, and I commented back to them about their rudeness. A supervisor was immediately called by staff to investigate me further. I was then subjected to a full body pat-down, including full touching of my midsection. While being subjected to the full pat down, two more times the supervisor was called by staff to further inspect me. Only when I offered a verbal apology to TSA staff for negative comments made about their behavior and lack of common courtesy was I allowed to proceed through the gate. With the exception of the supervisor, who clearly could find no visible violations in my passage, I found all the staff completely lacking in professionalism and common courtesy, and feel they actually went out of their way to make my passage through the gate even more difficult when I responded to their negative and aggressive behavior. On whole, this was the dirtiest, most disgusting aiport I've encountered. The floors are dirty, the restrooms not particularly clean, the staff are rude. I will do my best to avoid ever connecting here again.

commentHeader: run in the most unprofessional manner
reviewContent: Flew Icelandair into Newark Airport with connection to Florida. We arrived at Newark at 6.30pm and was down at carousel 2 to pick up bags by 6.45pm. We received our bags around 8.30pm. Many people with small kids and connecting flights with no updates from either Icelandair or Airport employees. Icelandair said it was a carousel issue but no one thought of switching us to the many carousels that were open. When I asked Airport employees for assistance and a Manager, I was shrugged off and told no manager was available. This is the worst airport I have ever used and the baggage areas are run in the most unprofessional manner I have ever experienced. Will never pass through again if I can avoid it.

Currently been standing in the queue for 1hr 40mins to check in and drop bags for a British Airways flight (even though we had already checked in online in the hope of avoiding any long queues). 250+ in the line and only one staff member checking customers in. The line was holding flyers to London and France and as the flight to France was boarding 40 mins earlier, all customers on this flight were allowed to queue jump to the front, even though many many people had prempted and planned to get to the airport early, and this was dismissed and still currently handing in the queue. Awful customer service and never queued at a stand still for so long, then disregarded to priorities customers that arrived late, with only ONE college checking people in at he counter. Ridiculous.

I tried 3 different Terminal C bathrooms and all were disgustingly dirty. Human waste all over toilets and floors. Puddles everywhere. It was absolutely horrible. Never seen anything like it in a US airport. The TSA lines were unnecessary slow. Couldn't wait to get out of there. I will never set foot in it again.

After many years, I was using Newark airport. Accessing it from New York City was smooth. I bought a through ticket from Penn Station on New Jersey Transit and made the connection at the Newark Airport Station on to the Air Train which connects the terminals.
